This role is deemed safety-sensitive and, as such, candidates will be subject to a drug test as a pre-employment requirement. The goal of the drug testing is to increase workplace safety in compliance with the applicable law.As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!At Boston Scientific, we recognize that nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace helps us be more innovative and it is important in our work of advancing science for life and improving patient health. That is why we stand for inclusion, equality, and opportunity for all. By embracing the richness of our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create a better, more rewarding place for our employees to work and reflect the patients, customers, and communities we serve. Boston Scientific is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.Boston Scientific maintains a drug-free workplace. Pursuant to Va. Code2.2-4312 (2000), Boston Scientific is providing notification that the unlawful manufacture, sale, distribution, dispensation, possession, or use of a controlled substance or marijuana is prohibited in the workplace and that violations will result in disciplinary action up to and including termination.Please be advised that certain US based positions, including without limitation field sales and service positions that call on hospitals and/or health care centers, require acceptable proof of COVID-19 vaccination status. Candidates will be notified during the interview and selection process if the role(s) for which they have applied require proof of vaccination as a condition of employment. Boston Scientific continues to evaluate its policies and protocols regarding the COVID-19 vaccine and will comply with all applicable state and federal law and healthcare credentialing requirements. As employees of the Company, you will be expected to meet the ongoing requirements for your roles, including any new requirements, should the Company’s policies or protocols change with regard to COVID-19 vaccination.

Title: Assistant, Global Distribution
Job Description: Summary Of PositionLionsgate is seeking an experienced Assistant to support the President, Global Licensing & Distribution of the Motion Picture Group whose oversight encompasses domestic and international Theatrical, Home Entertainment and Television distribution. The position will also support the EVP, Global Distribution of the Motion Picture Group. This position requires an ability to interact with staff at all levels and high profile contacts in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, all while remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality.ResponsibilitiesProvide critical support to the President, Global Licensing & Distribution and EVP, Global Distribution by handling advanced-level administrative duties, performing confidential assignments, and coordinating day-to-day operations.Assist with inbound/outbound company communication and correspondence. To that effect, it is paramount to become involved and knowledgeable in the department's operation and the business in general.Manage, organize, and serve as a gatekeeper to a complex and dynamic calendars, coordinating across global time zones.Organize virtual and in-person business meetings/calls, making all necessary arrangements, including booking rooms, arranging for required audio, video, catering, and other logistical support/tools as required. Manage cross-time-zone dynamics and arrange for external attendee security clearances, coordinating with remote office contacts as needed.Complete ad-hoc assignments as needed.Qualifications And SkillsExperience supporting Senior-Level Executives.Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (e.g. Excel, Word) and video conferencing; comfortable adopting new technology.Ability to work effectively under pressure without losing composure or professionalism.Should have a positive attitude and enthusiasm to build relationships across the organization and the company that will aid in effectively supporting the team.High level of integrity, with the ability to work on highly sensitive information while maintaining confidentiality.Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.Strong organizational skills and attention to detail with emphasis on accuracy, quality, and timeliness, taking personal accountability for all tasks.Passion for the business of entertainment with interest in a career in Global Distribution.About The CompanyLionsgate (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B) encompasses world-class motion picture and television studio operations aligned with the STARZ premium global subscription platform to bring a unique and varied portfolio of entertainment to consumers around the world. The Company’s film, television, subscription and location-based entertainment businesses are backed by a 17,000-title library and a valuable collection of iconic film and television franchises. A digital age company driven by its entrepreneurial culture and commitment to innovation, the Lionsgate brand is synonymous with bold, original, relatable entertainment for audiences worldwide.Business Unit OverviewMotion Picture GroupLionsgate’s motion picture business is a consistent box office market share leader with films that have grossed more than $10 billion worldwide over the past six years. This leadership is driven by world-class talent relationships, a deep and renewable portfolio of iconic brands and franchises, and a diverse and balanced slate that is built to enhance consumer enjoyment of the theatrical experience but also has the flexibility to utilize a broad range of alternative release strategies as the opportunities to monetize films continue to expand. The creator, owner and distributor of great film brands including The Hunger Games, Twilight Saga, John Wick, Now You See Me, Knives Out, La La Land, Saw, Dirty Dancing and Monster’s Ball, among many others, films released by Lionsgate and its predecessor companies have earned 129 Academy Award® nominations and 32 Oscar® wins.In addition to its mainstream commercial releases, Lionsgate’s Motion Picture Group includes specialty film distributor Roadside Attractions, an industry leader in award-winning prestige movies, Pantelion Films, the U.S. market leader in Spanish-language releases, a top film production and distribution brand in the UK, and multiplatform distributor Grindstone Entertainment.Our BenefitsFull Coverage – Medical, Vision, and DentalWork/Life Balance – generous sick days, vacation days, holidays, and Impact Day401(k) company matchingTuition Reimbursement (up to graduate degree)Compensation$40,000 - $42,000EEO StatementLionsgate is an equal employment opportunity employer. All employees and applicants are evaluated on the basis of their qualifications, consistent with applicable state and federal laws. In addition, Lionsgate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Lionsgate will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and federal law.

Title: Marketing Coordinator - Content Creation & Events
Job Description: TitleMarketing Coordinator - Content Creation & Events**HomeSafe Alliance**is the single global household goods movement manager of over 300,000 Military Household Goods moves per year for USTRANSCOM and the U.S. Armed Forces, Department of Defense civilians, U.S. Coast Guard, and their families.The**Marketing Coordinator - Content Creation & Events**position will be a member of the Strategic Engagements Team and a typical day will include leading our customer and B2B event marketing strategy and executing successful in-person and virtual events. This role will also support the Strategic Engagements Team in building brand awareness and fostering relationships across our various stakeholder groups. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.HomeSafe— Delivering Solutions, Changing the World.**HomeSafe has been established to be the premier household goods move management service provider for the U.S. Armed Forces, Department of Defense (DoD) civilians, and their families. Our team is dedicated to providing fast, easy, and efficient relocation experiences.More than 300,000 military and government households are relocated every year. Coordinating these transfers is a massive undertaking—and we’re proud to say that HomeSafe is positioned to improve the customers’ moving experience. As a household goods moving service integrator, we provide earlier visibility into upcoming moves and greater network throughput capacity—ensuring household goods shipments are picked up and delivered on time.With cutting-edge technology and proven logistics expertise, we’re transforming the moving process by continuously evaluating, refining, and improving our tools and techniques. We’re dedicated to making sure that every move is better than the last.We thank you for your service, and for the privilege of serving you in return.**A****t HomeSafe,****We Deliver.****Fraud Alert**Fraud has infiltrated the job placement market via the internet, email and direct phone contact. Attempts have included unauthorized use of HomeSafe’s name and logo to solicit potential job seekers or to extend false job offers. Bad actors may mix in fake job advertisements with legitimate postings. These ads can include contact instructions and require job seekers to send sensitive personal information or money to pay for visa applications, processing fees, etc., in exchange for consideration for a high-paying position.HomeSafe will never ask for any sort of advance payment as part of the recruiting/hiring process. Candidate profiles are carefully managed to protect personal information.BenefitsMedical, Dental and Vision Insurance.Paid time off (PTO) Three weeks of PTO for newly hired employees401(k)Health and Wellness ProgramsDisability, Life and AD&D insuranceEmployee Support programFamily Support: Bright Horizons, child and elder care servicesTeladoc Medical Experts, second opinion programTravel Accident & MedicalTRICARE Supplement PlanVoluntary Benefit PlansAnd more!

Title: Marketing Assistant
Job Description: Job description:Why Vistra At Vistra, we believe our clients’ businesses and people can make a difference in the world. That’s why our work is focused on helping our clients act with confidence and speed to seize opportunity wherever it arises. As a global corporate service provider and fund administrator with more than 5,000 professionals in over 45 jurisdictions, we empower legal entities globally to work smarter, grow faster, act responsibly, protect capital and scale across borders — by doing what we do best: reducing risk and enhancing efficiency. We support our clients over six sectors: Private Equity, Real Estate, Capital Markets, Corporate, Company Formation and Private Wealth and deliver value across three service lines:  Governance, Risk and Compliance Advisory and Transaction Support Finance, Accounting and Administration  We grow when you grow, and we succeed when we work together across boundaries and borders, as one team. So, our promise to our clients is the same to you: working together, we will give you the confidence, the tools and the support to achieve your ambitions and leverage your unique skills — to seize your opportunity and help make a difference in the world. You can also check out our LinkedIn Life page and our About us page to get a sense of Vistra’s culture and our values. So, what do you think? If you are excited about working with us and think you can get the job done but not quite sure if you meet all the requirements 100%, we want to encourage you to give it a try OR have an informal chat with one of our Talent Acquisition representatives.    Our opportunity for you: Vistra US is currently recruiting for a Marketing Assistant Purpose of Role                                The marketing executive will support the group marketing team in the delivery of campaigns to plan, working with US teams to support the delivery of leads alongside supporting the general sales funnel to close and win more business. Scope                          Based in the US, the Marketing executive will be required to support both our Funds and Corporate sector commercial teams.  Key Responsibilities                        Local Marketing collateral and content:  Help to develop, track and manage the delivery of local marketing assets, collateral and content. Items include, but not restricted to articles, blogs, press releases, newsletters, web content, webinars, video and social media posts.  Liaise with other country marketing teams where mutual projects or teamworking is required. Manage the updating and ongoing maintenance of all US focused webpages, including the people section and management of all new profiles.  Campaign deployment: Execute local demand generation campaigns.  Localise global sector and service programmes and deploy in country.  Leverage global marketing assets to support our client / sales journey Deliver marketing and brand support for events and conferences as required (including all merchandise and stand management). Own the social amplification approach for US commercial and account teams.  Assist in the delivery of pre and post-event and webinar activity, including event logistics, invitations, promotions and follow-up communications Additional Responsibilities: Maintain and track local marketing budget and spend, working with commercial teams and country marketing director to monitor ROI wherever possible Support where necessary with the country internal comms programme Use relevant tools to monitor the performance of local campaign initiatives, take necessary action and keep senior colleagues appraised. Manage and maintain the US marketing email lists by sector / sub sector / audience  Attributes/ Technical Skills                                     Strong interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal) Strong planning and time management skills, including the ability to work to deadlines with minimal supervision in a fast-paced environment Excellent computer skills, in particular Microsoft Office, email, Adobe Suite (InDesign/Photoshop) and CRM systems Knowledge of Hubspot or other marketing automation system Knowledge of webinar platforms such as ON24 Excellent attention to detail Flexibility and willingness to learn Problem-solving and creative-thinking skills   Relevant Experience                                    A minimum of 1 - 2 years’ work experience in a marketing role, ideally in the professional services sector  Education and Professional Qualification                         Educated to degree standard or equivalent. CIM qualifications are an advantage  Join US! Our promise to our clients is simple: we help them seize opportunity and make a difference in the world. It’s the same to you. Make a difference — seize your world of opportunity with Vistra! LET’S GROW TOGETHER.

Title: Product Marketing Manager - Remote | WFH
Job Description: We are looking for a passionate individual to join our team and help us revolutionize the way developers and product teams connect their users with what matters most, all in milliseconds! As a Product Marketing professional, you will play a vital role in bridging various functions and bringing them together seamlessly. Collaborating with cross-functional teams across product, marketing, sales, and customer success, you will be responsible for driving exciting outbound marketing efforts in the dynamic ecommerce vertical.In this role, you will have the opportunity to amplify our voice, showcase our thought leadership, and shape our point of view based on the go-to-market strategies defined by our Director of eCommerce Product Marketing. Staying ahead of our key competitors in the B2C ecommerce space will be crucial, and you will have the chance to deeply understand the search and discovery ecosystem, the B2C ecommerce industry, and the product life cycle. We value entrepreneurial spirit and encourage you to proactively seek opportunities by leveraging market research and engaging in customer conversations.Here's What Your Role Will EntailMonitor, analyze, and share market and competitive trends to identify messaging gaps and opportunities.Support content and demand generation campaign goals to drive impactful results.Regularly update website content to highlight use cases, persona-specific solutions, and new product releases.Collaborate with our corporate communications team to develop compelling industry award submissions.Create solution briefs and other enablement content to empower our field teams.Contribute to the production of external-facing point of views and thought leadership assets.Manage the execution of our advisory council to gather valuable insights and foster collaboration.You Might Be a Perfect Fit If You Have2+ years of experience in product marketing or a similar role that bridges product and marketing/go-to-market functions.Exceptional skills in collaborating with and influencing cross-functional teams.Strong understanding of the technology industry, and experience in the ecommerce space is a plus.Familiarity with outbound marketing channels and their workings.Comfort in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environment.Excellent communication and persuasive skills, coupled with active listening abilities.At Our Company, We Live By Our ValuesGRIT: We value problem-solving and perseverance in an ever-changing and growing environment.TRUST: We trust our co-workers and encourage ownership.CANDOR: We embrace constructive feedback, both giving and receiving.CARE: We genuinely care about our team members, clients, and the decisions we make as a company.HUMILITY: We have an aptitude for learning from others and setting ego aside.Remote StrategyOur company's workplace strategy, Hybrid Remote, is designed to harness the power of remote work opportunities for both employees and the company. We believe that an employee's impact, contribution, and output are more important than their physical location. With this approach, the majority of our employees have the flexibility to choose when and if they come into the office regularly. We do have specific moments that matter, such as critical planning meetings and team social gatherings, where in-person attendance may be required. However, 80% of our workforce can choose their preferred work location within the country of their hiring.About UsWe take pride in being a pioneering market leader, offering an AI-powered, API-First Search & Discovery platform that empowers over 12,000 businesses worldwide. Our platform allows businesses to deliver customer experiences at internet scale, with lightning-fast search and web browsing capabilities. Processing over 30 billion search requests per week, we surpass the combined efforts of major search engines like Microsoft Bing, Yahoo, Baidu, Yandex, and DuckDuckGo.As part of the next generation of software development, we are committed to creating APIs that make developers' lives easier. Our solutions offer a significant advantage over building from scratch or relying on monolithic SaaS solutions.In 2021, we closed $150 million in series D funding and quadrupled our post-money valuation to $2.25 billion. This substantial investment enables us to continuously enhance our market-leading platform and better serve our diverse range of customers, including notable brands like Under Armour, Petsmart, Stripe, Gymshark, and Walgreens.Our team is headquartered in San Francisco, and we have offices in Paris, London, New York, Austin, Atlanta, Sydney, and Bucharest.Who We're Looking ForWe are seeking talented and passionate individuals who want to contribute to building the world's best search and discovery technology. As an ownership-driven company, we value autonomy and diversity among our team members. We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace, welcoming individuals regardless of their race, age, ancestry, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, color, veteran status, disability, or socioeconomic background.READY TO APPLY?If you share our values and are excited about being part of a team that builds cutting-edge search and discovery technology, we can't wait to review your application!Employment Type: Full-TimeSalary: $ 90,000.00 114,000.00 Per Year

Help manage content calendars and ensure timely delivery of content.Social media management: Monitor and manage our social media accounts, including posting relevant content, responding to customer inquiries, and engaging with our online community. Stay updated on social media trends and recommend strategies for improving engagement and reach.Analytics and reporting: Track and analyze marketing metrics and campaign performance. Coordinate logistics, manage vendor relationships, and ensure seamless execution.Collaboration and coordination: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including design, sales, and product development, to ensure consistent messaging and brand alignment across all channels.RequirementsRequirements:Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field (or equivalent experience).Previous experience or internships in marketing, preferably within the home decor industry, is a plus.Strong written and verbal communication skills: Ability to write compelling and engaging content for various marketing channels. Experience with Google Analytics or similar tools is desirable.Creative thinking: Ability to generate innovative ideas and contribute to the development of marketing campaigns that resonate with our target audience.Highly organized and detail-oriented: Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment. Strong attention to detail is crucial for content creation and event coordination.Team player: Collaborative mindset with excellent interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships.Self-motivated and proactive: Willingness to take initiative, learn new skills, and adapt to evolving marketing trends and technologies.We offer competitive compensation, a dynamic work environment, and opportunities for growth and professional development within the home decor industry.To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio or work samples demonstrating your marketing capabilities.Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Title: Human Resources Coordinator
Job Description: Job DescriptionHouse of Spices is a deeply rooted brand within the food industry, leading the specialty food and ingredient category for over 50 years. Fast-forward from its start as a homegrown family business, House of Spices has become a middle-market wholesale/manufacturer which includes multiple distribution networks across the country. Although the business has and continues to expand rapidly, the brand is still family-owned and home-based out of the NYC metro area. We are looking for talented individuals to join our ACARE culture!The Human Resources Coordinator is responsible for performing all HR-related duties while demonstrating an ACARE value system. This position reports to the SVP of Human Resources and is a true business partner to all HOS Managers. The ideal individual in this role will work closely with senior management and frontline managers to provide HR support through a generalist function. This position carries out responsibilities in the following functional areas of HOS: Administration, Compliance, Benefits, HRIS Systems, Onboarding, Offboarding, Orientation/Training, SOPS, Talent planning, affirmative action and employment law compliance.Essential FunctionsAchieves staffing objectives by recruiting and evaluating job candidates; advising managers; and managing relocations and intern program. Establishes recruiting requirements by studying organization plans and objectives and meeting with managers to discuss needs. Attracts applicants by placing job advertisements, contacting recruiters, and using diverse job sites. Determines applicant qualifications by interviewing applicants, analyzing responses, verifying references, and comparing qualifications to job requirements. Arranges management interviews by coordinating schedules as well as facilitating any and all arrangements. Evaluates applicants by discussing job requirements and applicant qualifications with managers and interviewing applicants on a consistent set of qualifications. Improves organization attractiveness by recommending new policies and practices; monitoring job offers and compensation practices; and emphasizing benefits and perks. Manages new employee relocation by determining new employee requirements, negotiating with movers, arranging temporary housing, and providing DC introductions. Builds applicant sources by researching and contacting employment agencies, recruiters, media, and internet sites; providing organization information, opportunities, and benefits; making presentations; and maintaining rapport relationshipsCreates and improves the Talent Operating Procedures for HOS Distribution CentersBuild and Manager intern program by conducting orientations; scheduling rotations and assignments; monitoring intern job contributions; coaching interns; and advising managers on training and coaching. Avoids legal challenges by understanding current legislation, enforcing regulations with managers, recommending new procedures, and conducting training on hiring practices. Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations. Accomplishes human resources and organization mission by completing related results as needed. Required Education And ExperienceA bachelor's degree and minimum 3 years of HR/Recruitment experience, or a Master's degree and 2 years of experience in the HR fieldor 5 years of experience in the HR field, or any similar combination of education and experience.Preferred Education And ExperienceBachelors degree in human resources or related field. SHRM Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP)/(SHRM-CP) credential3 to 5 years of human resource experience. Outstanding knowledge of MS Office; HRIS systems/ ATS System requiredExcellent communication and people skillsDesire to work as a team with a results driven approachHindi/Urdu LanguageHouse of Spices Inc. strategies.Developing comprehensive digital campaign and web measurement strategies.Creating visually appealing dashboards, data visualizations, and detailed performance reports for campaigns and websites.Testing campaigns, analyzing crucial metrics, and identifying opportunities to optimize campaign performance.Sharing your findings through impactful presentations, offering actionable insights and recommendations to colleagues and senior management.Monitoring and analyzing digital media and marketing trends to stay at the forefront of the industry.Our Ideal Candidate Possesses The Following QualificationsA Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Psychology, or a related field.A minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in commercial digital/marketing/web analytics, preferably within media or eCommerce.Proficiency in gathering, cleansing, and analyzing website data using Google Analytics, such as GA360 and GA4.Familiarity with digital data platforms and tools, such as Adobe Analytics and Google Tag Manager.Experience building customized dashboards using BI tools like Tableau, Data Studio, or Power BI.Proven expertise in designing, executing, and analyzing statistical tests, including A/B tests.Strong knowledge of media channels and concepts, such as Display, Paid Search, SEM, SEO, and Social.Demonstrated ability to extract meaningful insights from web data, such as clickstream and website traffic.Proficiency in advanced analytics techniques, including LTV (Lifetime Value), trend analysis, and user journey analysis.Familiarity with advanced analytics data mining and scripting tools like Python, R, and SQL.Comfort working collaboratively with both technical and non-technical teams, as well as presenting insights to leaders.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to negotiate and present information effectively across the organization.Strong analytical and strategic thinking capabilities.Outstanding interpersonal and collaboration skills.Why join us?Our team is comprised of sociable, fun, creative, and passionate individuals who excel in their roles. We even have a pet-friendly office and regular Summer BBQs to strengthen team bonds.We are experiencing significant growth, providing exceptional opportunities for professional advancement within our organization. We prioritize internal talent when filling new positions.We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including a choice of two medical care options subsidized at 70% by the company, dental and vision coverage, a company matching 401(k) plan at 4%, employee discounts, exciting team events, and much more.About UsThe Annie Selke Companies have been achieving continuous success since our establishment in 1994. For over two decades, we have curated a collection of bedding, rugs, sleepwear, and home furnishings that we, and our customers, absolutely adore. Our stylish pieces are designed to stand out and stand the test of time.Join us on this exciting journey and be a part of our thriving team. Title: Product Marketing Manager
Job Description: Product Marketing Manager, Ancient Grain and Gluten-Free FloursArdent Mills is seeking a dynamic individual who is passionate about strategic marketing, sales enablement, new product innovation and the food industry. We are searching for an individual with experience in marketing / brand management or related background and has a passion for driving product growth with customers (B2B). An ideal candidate will have strategic and analytical skills, and a passion for identifying opportunities to drive sustainable profitable growth of Ardent Mills’ alternative grains products. Ardent Mills’ alternative grains portfolio currently includes pulses and a broad set of ancient grains, in many formats – this role will focus on ancient grain and other gluten-free flours. Ardent Mills is focused on aggressively growing these product lines which strongly resonate with customers and consumers. This role will report to the Senior Product Marketing Manager, Alternative Grains.As a Product Marketing Manager, the Ardent Mills Values of Trust, Serving, Simplicity, and Safety will guide your decisions. You will work with your team to deliver superior business results while embracing a mindset of change resiliency, showcasing learning agility, and challenging yourself for continuous growth & development.To Succeed, You Must Be Able ToDeliver results in first-time situations by inspiring others and working to earn trust every day.Serve others with understanding, respect, and care.Operate with simplicity, clarity and transparency.Deal with and drive change.Organize, prioritize, and own multiple tasks while meeting or exceeding deadlines.Learn and apply new technology and share knowledge with others.Above all you will be expected to carry out all your activities with reliability, integrity, compliance and in a safe, environmentally responsible, and efficient manner.Your ResponsibilitiesGather and leverage market data, consumer, customer, and competitive insights to continually evolve our understanding of the focus product lines (ancient grain flour and other GF flour) and ingredient marketplace and help inform priorities of marketing and broader organization. Regularly provide these insights to our selling teams and other cross-functional stakeholders.In collaboration with partners including EN, develop go-to-market growth strategies for focus product lines. Title: Marketing & Events Coordinator
Job Description: Quicksilver is a pioneer in the natural health industry. Our mission is to deliver on the promise of natural medicine, delivering products that help individuals achieve mind and body health through nature inspired innovation. Our growth is fueled by individuals who share our passion. Currently, we have an opening for a Social Media Coordinator in our Lafayette, CO office.The Social Media Coordinator will be responsible for the day-to-day social media functions including management of Quicksilver's influencer and guerilla social marketing. Identify organic, on-brand influencer relationships that go beyond strict business, constantly monitoring performance and optimizing accordingly. Audit our current social media, blog, and influencer efforts and suggest plans, including campaign proposals, target influencers, post guidelines, and necessary setup. Structure pitches to attract influencers that fit our criteria, working with those that opt in to negotiate terms and structure posts before launching. Continue to grow the program, solidifying successful influencer relationships, monitoring posts and results, reporting back on findings, and making adjustments to optimize our strategy. Use Klear/Meltwater platform to find and communicate with influencers (bloggers, social media personalities, industry movers, etc.).Completes special projects and performs other related duties and assignments as assigned.QualificationsQualified candidates must have a BA/BS degree in Marketing or a related field including a minimum of 1-year experience in digital and social media marketing. In addition, the person must have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Lastly, the person must possess effective problem-solving techniques and be able to interact effectively with all levels of employees and external contacts.Ideal Candidates Have The Following TraitsSelf-driven and motivated with strong initiative - will be a self-starter, able to work both with and without direction, and have strong judgement skills for on-the-fly decision makingStrong interest and experience in photography and graphic design experience a plus (Adobe Creative Suite). Well-developed creative skills to design and maintain eye-catching copy and images.Numerically literate, comfortable working with numbers, making sense of metrics and processing figures with spreadsheets.Strong creative copy-writer skills.Stays current on industry trends and proactively builds skill and experience in areas relevant to marketing and design.Quicksilver Offers a Competitive Benefits Package IncludingEmployer paid Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance; including Short-term and Long-term Disability.401K with company matching.Paid vacation and sick time.Paid company holidays.Fitness Center membership.Generous employee discount program on all QS products.Quicksilver Scientific is an equal opportunity employer. Title: Product Marketing Manager
Job Description: At Noonlight, an Alarm.com company, our mission is to protect and comfort people so they can live freely. What began as an app focused on helping people walk safely from point A to point B, is now a suite of emergency response APIs backing some of the smartest home, health, and lifestyle products in the IoT market.Please make sure you read the following details carefully before making any applications.Noonlight is looking for a Product Marketing Manager to lead marketing efforts for our B2B/API products for IoT customers. In this role, you will define and drive the end-to-end marketing strategy for business-facing products, in close partnership with product, sales, and Noonlight’s leadership team. We are looking for a PMM who is passionate about the intersection of safety and technology, has an experiment-first mindset, and is excited about shaping a marketing strategy for API products.ResponsibilitiesStrategy Development : Collaborate with the Noonlight leadership team to define the marketing strategy and positioning for Noonlight's B2B products. Identify target customer segments, develop value propositions, and establish key messaging to differentiate our offerings in the market.Product Positioning : Develop compelling and differentiated product positioning that resonates with target customers. Clearly communicate the unique value proposition and benefits of our API & B2B offerings to drive customer engagement and adoption.Marketing Campaigns : Leverage an “experiment-first” approach to create and execute integrated marketing campaigns to generate demand and drive awareness of our business-facing products. Utilize a mix of digital marketing, content marketing, social media, events, and other marketing channels to reach target audiences effectively.Market Research and Analysis : Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and customer segmentation to identify market trends, customer needs, and areas for product differentiation. Use data-driven insights to inform marketing strategies and optimize the positioning of our B2B products.Sales Enablement : Collaborate with sales, product, and customer success teams to develop sales enablement materials, including presentations, collateral, case studies, and sales tools. Ensure that the sales team has the necessary resources to effectively sell our B2B products and achieve their targets.Customer Success Collaboration : Collaborate with the customer success team to develop customer retention and expansion strategies. Leverage customer feedback and insights to inform marketing campaigns and drive customer engagement with our B2B products.Performance Measurement : Define key performance indicators (KPIs) for marketing initiatives and campaigns. Monitor and analyze marketing metrics, including lead generation, conversion rates, customer acquisition costs, and revenue growth, to assess the effectiveness of marketing efforts.Requirements5+ years of Product Marketing Experience, with previous experience developing an end-to-end marketing strategy for a product(s)Passion for software as a service and new technologies (prior experience working on SaaS products/APIs a plus)Experience with experiment design and execution to test, validate, and develop a marketing strategyExcellent written and verbal communication skillsComfortable with ambiguity, with a bias towards actionAbility to work effectively in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environmentExperience supporting complex, technical productsCOMPANY INFONoonlight combines advanced technology with real humans to protect and comfort people so they can live freely. Launched in 2013 as a mobile application, Noonlight has since grown into a connected safety platform — partnering with products and services to enable modern and affordable 24/7 professional sensor monitoring, video monitoring, false alarm filtering, and data-rich emergency response via an API. Noonlight’s technology works everywhere in the United States and Canada, allowing end users to quickly get help in any situation, without requiring a 911 call or the ability to talk or text. Noonlight was recently acquired by Alarm.com, furthering its vision of automatic safety. It continues to operate as an independent business, with the elite knowledge, benefits, and backing of Alarm.com.For more information please visit www.noonlight.com or www.alarm.com.COMPANY BENEFITSAlarm.com offers competitive pay and benefits including a wide choice of healthcare options with generous company subsidy, a health savings account option with company contribution, 401(k) with employer match, paid holidays and paid time off increasing with tenure, paid maternity and paternity leave, company paid STD/LTD and life insurance, flexible spending accounts, and a casual dress work environment.Alarm.com is an Equal Opportunity EmployerIn connection with your application, we collect information that identifies, reasonably relates to or describes you (“Personal Information”). The categories of Personal Information that we may collect include your name, government-issued identification number(s), email address, mailing address, other contact information, emergency contact information, employment history, educational history, criminal record, and demographic information. We collect and use those categories of Personal Information about you for human resources and other business management purposes, including identifying and evaluating you as a candidate for potential or future employment or future positions, record keeping in relation to recruiting and hiring, conducting criminal background checks as permitted by law, conducting analytics, and ensuring compliance with applicable legal requirements and Company policies.

Title: Community Events Coordinator
Job Description: Facility ProfileTGH is the area’s only level I trauma center and one of just two ABA-verified adult & pediatric burn centers in Florida. With five medical helicopters*, we transport critically injured or ill patients from 23 surrounding counties to receive the advanced care they need. The hospital is home to one of the busiest solid organ transplant centers in the country. TGH is a nationally designated comprehensive stroke center, and has a 32-bed Neuroscience Intensive Care Unit. Other outstanding centers include cardiovascular, orthopedics, high-risk and normal obstetrics, urology, ENT, endocrinology, and the Children’s Medical Center, which features a nine-bed pediatric intensive care unit and pediatric kidney transplant services. As the region’s leading safety net hospital, Tampa General is committed to providing area residents with world-class and compassionate health care ranging from the simplest to the most complex medical services.Tampa General Hospital was named the #1 hospital in Tampa Bay by U.S. News & World Report, 2020-2021, and recognized as one of America's Best Hospital's in five medical specialties: Cardiology & Heart Surgery, Diabetes & Endocrinology, Gastroenterology & GI Surgery, Nephrology, and Orthopedics. Tampa General Hospital has been designated a Magnet Hospital by the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC), the highest recognition for nursing excellence, for the fourth consecutive time – an accomplishment that fewer than one percent of hospitals nationwide have earned. TGH is accredited by The Joint Commission and was awarded disease-specific certification in five medical specialties. Passion for uncovering the latest digital marketing and social media platforms and tools.Excellent verbal, written, presentation and problem-solving skills.Experience working with influencer networks, individual influencers and influencer identification, management and measurement tools.Experience creating and executing paid social and digital campaigns across social channels such as Facebook, Snapchat, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn.Ability to execute and measure multifaceted campaigns and day-to-day communications initiatives.A strong understanding of digital and content marketing strategies, the ability to integrate campaign elements across earned, owned and paid media, and apply analytics to measure results and provide insights.Highly adaptable and ability to shift priorities in real-time to meet client needs.Please note: Preferred location is Dallas, and we are open to considering qualified remote candidates in other locations.Golin has included the base salary range or hourly rate for this role. Title: Content Marketing Specialist
Job Description: NBX Wellness is looking for a skilled Content Marketer to help guide and develop social media, blog, and gated content for our brand. As the Content Marketing Specialist, you will work closely with the Education team to plan, create, and customize content for various channels for both lead generation and to build brand awareness. You will be required to research target audiences, manage the content creation and publishing process, and monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).NBX Wellness is a B2B2C company, focusing on Ecommerce solutions and genetic guided supplementation for wellness providers. Formerly known as DrNeurobiologix, NBX Wellness has been at the forefront of nutrigenomics since 2009. The bulk of the content this role will be responsible for creating will be targeted toward various segments of wellness providers, but some content will also need to be created for their clients and patients.  Content Marketing Specialist Estimated Division of Duties:Social Media Management: 40% Content Creation for Lead Generation & Account Activation: 40%Reporting & Planning: 20%Content Marketing Specialist Responsibilities:Meeting with the marketing and education teams to ideate and define content goals, including SEO strategy, gated content for lead generation, and brand-building on social media.Researching content and trends to ensure that content is relevant and appealing.Developing content strategies to effectively reach the desired target audience and marketing goals.Creating content for a variety of platforms including blogs, websites, and social media.Proofreading and editing content before publishing.Managing content calendars and ensuring that the content remains consistent across all platforms.Coordinating with the marketing, website, and education teams to ensure the timely delivery of assignments.Tracking content analytics and generating reports and presentations (primarily using Google Analytics and HubSpot).Monitor and report on KPIs on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis. Content Marketing Specialist Requirements:Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, journalism, or similar.A minimum of three years of experience in content creation, marketing, communications, or similar.Familiarity with Google Analytics, HubSpot, Adobe Suite, and Canva is preferred. Good knowledge of various content platforms such as social media, blogs, and print media.Strong understanding of content practices such as SEO, Organic Social, and Paid Social.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.The ability to keep abreast of content trends and advancements in technology.

Title: Product Coordinator
Job Description: Job SummaryWe have an immediate opening for a Promotional Product Coordinator. In this role, you will review orders, input them into our customer relationship management system and order portal, and process the orders to ensure the shipment is fulfilled properly and delivered on time. Title: Media and Communications Specialist
Job Description: Media and Communications Specialist - ( 230004TW )DescriptionThe Education Secretariat is committed to equity and valuing the unique and diverse characteristics and experiences of every member of its workforce. We encourage an authentic workplace where colleagues show up as their full selves, where collaboration, innovation, and connections are key to realizing our mission that all children, youth, and families thrive socially, academically, and economically. We seek teammates who are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive work environment, where everyone is valued and engaged. We encourage you to apply and identify your strengths in these areas.The Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education provides leadership, oversight, funding, support, and accountability for the Commonwealth's approximately 400 school districts that educate close to 1 million public school children each year. We also oversee programs that serve 20,000 adult learners each year. Our work is guided by five strategic priorities and the commissioner's Our Way Forward plan.The Office of Communication and Planning oversees internal and external communications for the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education. This includes all media inquiries and direct contact with k-12 education community, members of the Board of Elementary and Secondary, and the general public.The Communication Specialist is responsible for development and writing a variety of communication pieces to a broad audience to ensure that the Department’s message is accurately and effectively portrayed in the local, state, national media and beyond.Key Responsibilities The selected candidate will:  Handle all inquiries from the media and manage the Department’s responses;  Provide primary support to the Office of the Commissioner around state and local media outreach and news monitoring;  Develop and write effective communications for external audiences;  Prepare briefing documents, correspondence, and other communication materials for the Commissioner’s Office;  Draft op-ed’s, press releases, talking points, and other communication materials, including the Commissioner’s weekly update and other newsletters to the education community;  Gather content from other agency centers/offices and assist in the development of key communication materials related to their work;  Produce and edit content for the Department’s website, including targeted communications around key initiatives and programs;  Develop relationships internally and externally with key stakeholders to effectively convey the Department’s core mission and work;  Perform other duties as assigned.  Based on assignment, travel throughout the Commonwealth is required.  Desired Knowledge, Skills, and Experience:  Below are characteristics we will look for in the selection process. We recognize that the depth of each individually and the balance of all of them collectively may vary from candidate to candidate and, as such, we encourage applications from individuals with a range of backgrounds, experiences, and skills. At least four years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in media relations or public relations as a writer, reporter, or journalist;  Excellent written and oral communication skills, as well as strong organizational skills;  Strong understanding of media relations and the ability to make well-informed decisions;  Expertise in using virtual communication technologies;  Intermediate to advanced knowledge and skills with Microsoft Office applications;  Ability to collect, understand, present, analyze and interpret data accurately and objectively;  Demonstrated success in managing multiple tasks under strict deadlines; and demonstrated ability to work in a collaborative environment as well as work independently with minimal supervision:  Must have a bachelor’s degree in journalism, communication, public relations, or related field;  Travel within state and/or out of state may be required:  Supervisory experience:  Superior project management skills;  Ability to effectively manage varied projects while balancing multiple and competing priorities;  Experience working with a range of diverse stakeholders and tailoring approach and communications to successfully meet project goals and timelines;  Strong interpersonal skills, including ability to establish rapport, motivate, and maintain p ositive and productive relationships with colleagues and clients from diverse backgrounds;  Ability to process and assimilate detailed factual information presented orally or in writing;  Demonstrated attentiveness to detailed tasks and a record of accomplishing such tasks without direct supervision;  Ability to exercise sound judgment;  Ability to work with confidential information and maintain the highest level of confidentiality;  Knowledge of state and federal education laws and the culture, organization, and structures of schools and districts; and  Strong computer skills and proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook  Please include a cover letter and resume with your online application.  Questions regarding this posting or the application process should be referred to Maureen O’Brien @  maureen .t.o’brien @mass.govThis position is based at the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education in Malden. Staff are currently operating within a hybrid model, telecommuting up to three days per week.QualificationsFirst consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.MINIMUM ENTRANCE REQUIREMENTS: Applicants must have at least (A) three years of full time, or equivalent part-time, professional, administrative or managerial experience in business administration, business management or public administration the major duties of which involved program management, program administration, program coordination, program planning and/or program analysis, or (B) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below.SubstitutionsI. A Bachelor's degree with a major in business administration, business management or public administration may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the-required experience.*II. A Graduate degree with a major in business administration, business management or public administration may be substituted for the required experience.*III. A Bachelor's or higher degree with a major other than in business administration, business management or public administration may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required experience.*Education toward such a degree will be prorated on the basis of the proportion of the requirements actually completed. Comprehensive Benefits When you embark on a career with the Commonwealth, you are offered an outstanding suite of employee benefits that add to the overall value of your compensation package. We take pride in providing a work experience that supports you, your loved ones, and your future.Want the specifics? Explore our Employee Benefits and Rewards!Executive Order #595: As a condition of employment, successful applicants will be required to have received COVID-19 vaccination or an approved exemption as of their start date. Details relating to demonstrating compliance with this requirement will be provided to applicants selected for employment. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.The Commonwealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. Title: Vice President of Customer Success
Job Description: Join our small but growing team dedicated to building the top-rated SaaS platform for high-performing, highly engaged teams!Job Description(US Only)Bonusly is hiring a VP, Customer Success to ensure that our customers achieve their desired outcomes using Bonusly, and thus serves as a vital leader to achieving our revenue goals. You will utilize your love of data 📈 and expertise for creating repeatable, scalable processes 🔁 to ensure our customers are receiving massive value from our product. You won't be doing this work alone! You will be entrusted with the rewarding work of forecasting headcount, actively recruiting new hires, creating training and onboarding processes, and ensuring your team members have what they need to be successful. You will oversee our CS organization which includes Customer Success activities (onboarding, education, support, adoption, retention, etc.) and outcomes (renewals, upsell, etc.). Title: Medical Assistant - Sacramento, CA (40hrs Weekly, PTO, Benefits)
Job Description: Highlights Of Working At Everside HealthCompetitive health benefits that start 1st of month after start date 15 days of PTO plus paid holidaysNo out-of-pocket cost for scrubs Pay Range: $23.00 - $28.00/hr The actual offer may vary dependent upon geographic location and the candidate’s years of experience and/or skill level. About UsAt Everside Health we are building the most trusted, accessible and personalized healthcare experience alongside our patients and clients. With 20+ years’ experience from our shared organizations, we hold a unified goal of building deep, trusted and lasting relationships with our patients and clients. As Everside Health, we are guided by our core principles of Patients First, Courage, Ingenuity, Community, and Fun.About The RoleWe are currently looking for an experienced Medical Assistant to join our team. The Medical Assistant is a key component of our care team and works closely with a primary care physician to deliver excellent patient care and provide an exceptional guest experience to our patients. Because of our unique model, our Medical Assistants oversee the full spectrum of the patient experience- acting both as a Medical Receptionist as well as assuming clinical responsibilities of a Medical Assistant. Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesThe following duties and responsibilities generally reflect the expectations of this position but are not intended to be all-inclusive.Escorts patients to room and ensures that exam rooms are thoroughly cleaned and stocked Reviews previous medical information and gathers any relevant updated health information from the patient to inform the provider Take vitals, perform blood draws, give injections, bandage wounds, assist with procedures. Work with the contracted labs for additional tests Prepares and administers approved medications and immunizations via oral, topical, inhaled, intramuscular, subcutaneous or intradermal at the direction of and upon written order from the Provider Partners with other members of the care team to develop individual patient plan of care including identifying and working to address gaps in care Front desk duties, including: patient scheduling, medical record requests and abstraction, documentation, coordinate specialist visits, referrals, and other care outside of the clinic, check-in, check-out, etc.  Records accurate and pertinent data in the medical record according to documentation guidelines Process test results and provide the patient with timely results via e-message, mail or phone as directed in written instructions by the Provider Participates in outreach to patients to drive engagement among eligible patient groups Maintains clinical and office supplies and equipment for treatments About YouMinimum of 1 year of experience working as a Medical Assistant, preferably in Primary Care. May vary based on clinic needsGraduation from a formal Medical Assistant program or other related program National or state-specific MA certification or registration is strongly preferred. MA certification or registration is required for employment in States where certification/registration is required.CPR/BLS certification required at time of start date Phlebotomy experience is preferredEverside Benefits SummaryWe believe in empowering teammates to do their best work and build better healthcare. Below are some of our benefit offerings. Eligibility is based on 24/hr week.Health and Well-Being: Free Everside membership for in person and virtual care, employer paid life and disability insurance, and choice in medical/dental plans, vision, employer funded HSA, FSA, and voluntary illness, accident and hospitalization plans. Benefits are effective on the first of the month following date of hire. Financial Support: Competitive compensation, 401k match, access to financial coaching through our Employee Assistance ProgramLifestyle: Paid time off for vacation, sick leave, and more, holiday scheduleLearn more at https://www.eversidehealth.com/careers/

Title: Communication and Recruitment Coordinator
Job Description: Job DescriptionSan Francisco Conservation Corps is Now Hiring!﻿Job Title: Communications & Recruitment CoordinatorClassification: Non-Exempt (hourly), Full-TimeCompensation: $26-$31 per hour based on experienceDepartment: Planning and Evaluation DepartmentLocation: Primary: SFCC Administrative Building. The position will also be conducting outreach and recruitment activities with community partners, educational institutions, and in various neighborhoods throughout San Francisco.Reports to: Director of Planning and EvaluationProgram DescriptionThe San Francisco Conservation Corps (SFCC) provides paid work experience, educational attainment, career readiness services, and barrier remediation for transitional aged youth 18-26. The corpsmembers work in programs that focus on recycling and sustainability, habitat restoration, climate resilience, zero waste facilitation, horticulture, landscaping, urban farming, public lands improvements, and more. The program provides participants with opportunities to improve academic skills & abilities, job readiness, and prepare for higher education, career development and employment. SFCC has an on-site campus of the John Muir Charter School, allowing Corpsmembers who have not yearned their diploma to work towards completing that goal while participating in paid hands-on job training. For participants that already have their high school diploma, we provide additional educational and vocational training opportunities.Job SummaryThe Communication & Recruitment Coordinator works in the Planning and Evaluation Department and in the planning, preparation, and implementation of outreach, recruitment, and orientation services for new and potential Corpsmembers at the SFCC. They are also responsible for updating SFCC’s website and social media channels and coordinating with and assisting the Director of Planning and Evaluation in creating, editing, and revising written reports, media releases, and other documents.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Outreach & Recruitment: Developing, revising, and distributing recruitment flyers; preparing, presenting, and assisting with presentations; assisting with preparation, implementation and presentation of SFCC Information Sessions and applicant interviews; and assisting with preparation, implementation and presentation of new Corpsmember Orientation and other retention services. Managing online applications. Recruitment will be for a year-round program and a summer program.  Communications- Working with Director of Planning and Evaluation to update SFCC website, www.sfcc.org as well as SFCC social media channels (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter). Assist Director of Planning and Evaluation in production of fund-raising requests, press releases, and organizational reports.  Administrative Support: Making phone calls, sending correspondence (mail outs, email) and collecting documentation for data entry; scheduling interviews, photocopying materials; compiling information/packets; updating recruitment and contact spreadsheet; scanning and uploading documents; assisting with maintaining files.  Development and Training: Participate in orientation and required training sessions; learn and adhere to SFCC policies and procedures; take and follow directions and instructions from appropriate staff members; take care of all issues equipment and SFCC property; follow schedules and attendance requirements; fulfill performance expectations, follow all SFCC standards and expectations related to conducting a respectful workplace, work and get along with co-workers and SFCC staff.  Leadership and Communications: Represent SFCC at community meetings, outreach events, recruitment and job fair events and other meetings; Maintain respectful communication with co-workers, corpsmembers, John Muir Charter School Staff at all times.  Data and Reporting- Assist with data input and reporting into Launchpad, SFCC’s database built on the Salesforce platform. The data from Launchpad is reported to various SFCC funding sources and the Communications and Recruitment Coordinator will need to work with SFCC’s Data Analyst and the Corpsmember Development staff on these reports. This will include tracking documents and narratives, for monthly, quarterly, and annual reports.  Coordination- Coordinates with all relevant staff in closely tracking program required outcomes, project solutions to problem areas, and maintain a professional working partnership with program funders (as needed)Typical Working ConditionsTypical conditions include working in an office setting; constant keyboarding, handling, and other repetitive hand motions; and constant sitting. Work conditions also include visiting various neighborhoods in San Francisco by vehicle and walking. Also standing for longer periods of time for recruiting events.Minimum Requirements At least 21 years of age Bachelor’s Degree preferred, or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.  Minimum of 3 years of experience with one or more of the following service areas: community outreach, participant recruitment, public speaking, new participant orientation, intake services, or related other related work.  Ability to work independently on and off site.  Knowledge of and comfortable with using Microsoft Office Suite applications (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) Valid CA Driver’s License and ability to be covered on agency license (preferred)The SFCC is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records/Americans With Disabilities ACT (ADA) Title I and Title V of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (ADA), as amended, protect qualified applicants and employees with disabilities from discrimination in hiring, promotion, discharge, pay, job training, fringe benefits, classification, referral, and other aspects of employment on the basis of disability. The law also requires that covered entities provide qualified applicants and employees with disabilities with reasonable accommodation, unless such accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the employer.Visit our website at www.sfcc.org for more information. Company DescriptionA nonprofit that combines paid work experience for youth aged 18-26 with educational attainment, career readiness, and barrier remediation. SFCC's work experience for the youth is primarily in the areas of climate resilience, urban farming, horticulture, recycling, and zero waste facilitation.

Title: Digital Marketing - Customer Acquisition Manager
Job Description: Job specificationSlate Digital is seeking a highly skilled, results-driven Digital Marketing Customer Acquisition Manager to join our growing team. As Acquisition Manager, you will be responsible for planning, implementing, and managing digital advertising campaigns to drive customer acquisition for a subscription-based Audio FX plugin service. Your role will involve conducting market research, staying up-to-date with the latest technology and trends and optimizing campaigns for business growth. Additionally, you will oversee organic social media content management and to ensure consistent brand presence and engagement with our target audience. Your collaboration with the Marketing Retention Manager, Influencer Manager and content team will be essential to align acquisition, retention and influencer marketing strategies.This key role reports to the Marketing Director and is based in our Los Angeles office with the potential for a hybrid working schedule.RolesResponsibilities:Digital Advertising Campaign Planning, Implementation, and Management:Develop and execute digital advertising campaigns across platforms (Google Search, Instagram/Facebook and TikTok) to acquire new customers for Slate Digital products.Work with the content team to develop campaign materials, including video, ad copy, images and landing pages, to maximize reach and conversions.Monitor campaign performance, optimize ads based on key metrics (e.g., click-through rates, conversion rates), and adjust bidding strategies to achieve campaign KPIs.Stay up-to-date with the latest digital advertising tools, trends and best practices. Campaign Analysis and Optimization:Identify areas for campaign optimization and A/B test different ad variations, targeting options, and landing page designs to improve conversion rates.Utilize data analytics to measure campaign attribution and assess the impact of different marketing channels on customer acquisition.Collaborate with the marketing retention specialist to share campaign insights and data for a holistic view of customer acquisition and retention efforts.Prepare weekly reports for review by the Marketing Director and senior staff.Organic Social Media Content Management:Oversee organic social media channels (e.g., Instagram, YouTube, TikTok and Facebook) to drive brand awareness, engagement, and lead generation.Work with the content team to develop a strategy that aligns with the brand's voice and resonates with the target audience.Create and schedule social media posts, monitor engagement, and work with customer support to manage responses to comments and messages promptly.Collaborate with the Marketing Retention Manager and Influencer Manager to ensure consistency in messaging, branding, and customer journey across organic social media and retention efforts.Interaction and Planning with the Marketing Retention Manager:Regularly communicate and collaborate with the Marketing Retention Manager to align organic/paid acquisition and retention strategies and share insights.Work with Influencer Marketing colleagues to align strategies and share insights.Plan and execute integrated marketing campaigns that combine acquisition and retention efforts to maximize customer lifetime value and loyalty.Your profileQualifications:Bachelor's degree in marketing, advertising, business, or a related field.At least 5 years of proven experience as a digital marketer, specifically in planning and executing successful digital advertising campaignsIn-depth knowledge of digital advertising platforms (Google Search, YouTube, Instagram/Facebook and TikTok) and their targeting capabilities.Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, analyze campaign performance, and optimize for results.Experience managing organic social media channels and developing engaging content.Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.Detail-oriented, with strong organizational and project management skills.Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and thrive in a fast-paced environment.A creative thinker with a problem-solving mindset and a passion for continuous improvement.Familiarity with the SaaS industry and audio-related products is a plus.Desired but not required:Musician or content creator with home recording experienceFamiliar with audio recording technologyWorked for a music recording/content creation software company in a similar roleOur CompanySlate Digital is a rapidly growing business comprising two distinct, highly integrated operating units. The first unit, located in Grenoble, France, is composed of our R&D and software development teams. The second unit is based in Los Angeles, USA, and encompasses our Sales, Marketing, Support, and Product teams.Slate Digital is proud to be a part of the Audiotonix Group, a collection of premium audio and content creation brands. This association further fuels our evolution and expansion.About UsSlate Digital is among the most respected names in professional audio, specializing in the industry’s most authentic analog-modeled DSP software plugins, as well as creating the number one selling microphone and control surfaces in the United States. The world’s most influential recording artists & engineers are among our customers, but we pride ourselves on being affordable, user-friendly, and accessible to anyone wanting to record, mix, and master audio.As a growing company, our goal is to build an inspired and creative team pursuing industry-changing products.

Title: Marketing & Communications Assistant
Job Description: Mon-Fri 9am-5.30pm. Bilingual Spanish speaking candidates encouraged to apply. **Salary Range: $40,000 - $50,000 per yearORGANIZATION INFORMATION:Momentum for Health is one of the largest nonprofit providers of behavioral health services in Santa Clara County. Each year, we serve 4,000 adults and youth living with a mental illness. Our comprehensive programs and services include prevention and early intervention, adult and transitional age youth (14 to 24) outpatient services, employment services, day rehabilitation, addiction treatment services, residential treatment, supported housing, and a volunteer program. Momentum works to reduce and eliminate stigma that surrounds mental illness and behavioral health care through a community relations program that promotes education, diversity, and collaboration.SUMMARY: The Marketing & Communications Assistant is responsible for coordinating and creating content and deliverables to support the organization’s overall strategic Marketing & Communications plan. This role will manage Momentum’s social media channels and website maintenance, as well as provide creative, event and administrative support. This role will also work closely with the Marketing & Communications Manager to develop print and digital collateral. The Marketing & Communications Assistant will work collaboratively within the organization to meet organizational objectives through social media efforts and tracking performance through detailed analytics. Please note that while this position can be partially remote, fully remote work is not possible. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage social media channels using HootSuite and publish content (including organic posts and paid ads) across Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and the Momentum for Health blog. *Develop and maintain the social media calendar in accordance with our marketing priorities and objectives, including maximizing awareness of Momentum programs. *Coordinate and schedule monthly e-newsletter, soliciting content from internal stakeholders across departments, and help create additional email campaigns as necessary for events and announcements. *Maintain and update content on the Momentum for Health website. *Support Momentum programs by providing or creating print and digital collateral as needed.Partner closely with internal stakeholders to craft content that is relevant to our audiences and reflects the Momentum brand voice and identity.Ideate around upcoming Momentum milestones, stories and moments to translate into creative concepts for social media, newsletter, and other platforms. *Utilize Canva for social content creation. *Conduct analyses of content performance. *Manage ongoing competitive analysis and trends research.Serve as a social media subject matter expert within Momentum and help enforce best practices on social media. *Provide event support for Momentum’s annual fundraising events and resource fairs. *Provide administrative support to Momentum’s Marketing & Communications team. *Support the Marketing & Communications team with other duties as assigned. *KNOWLEDGE, SKILL AND ABILITIES REQUIRED: (E = Essential; D = Desired)The ideal candidate will be creative, passionate about social media and advocating for behavioral health care, and comfortable working with a small but highly collaborative team. We are looking for someone with the following qualities:Experience in Marketing, Social Media and Advertising or related field (E)Robust design skills and knowledge of design concepts a plus (D)Working familiarity with HootSuite, Canva, and email marketing platforms (D)Excellent verbal and written communication skills (E); bilingualism a plus (D)Ability to work in autonomous environment with changing priorities (E)Solid understanding of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) (D)Extreme attention to detail (E)Ability to interact daily with people at different levels within the organization including developing and maintaining ongoing relationships (E)Strong interpersonal skills, amicable and professional demeanor (E)Self-starter who is eager to participate and contribute (E)Legally eligible to work in the country in which the position is located (E)Possess a valid California Driver License, with access to a reliable vehicle or for driving an Agency vehicle, current proof of auto liability insurance, and a documented clean DMV. (D)
