Title: Social Media & Marketing Coordinator (PT)
Job Description: Do you have a knack for storytelling? Always capturing the moment on your phone? Up to date on social media trends? We’re hiring for a dynamic position that will allow you to contribute your skillset to an excellent cause! We are seeking a highly creative and driven Social Media/Marketing Coordinator to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for creating engaging and visually appealing content for a variety of social media platforms. The role will involve working closely with the marketing team to develop content that aligns with our mission and resonates with our target audience. Experience in a nonprofit or service environment is beneficial but not required.ResponsibilitiesCreate, curate, and manage engaging and visually appealing content for social media platforms, including but not limited to Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, TikTok and LinkedIn.Collaborate with the marketing team and videographer to develop content that aligns with our mission and storytelling/fundraising campaigns.Stay up to date with the latest social media trends and best practices to ensure that our content is relevant and engaging.Monitor and analyze social media metrics to measure the effectiveness of our content and make data-driven decisions.Assist with the planning and execution of social media campaigns throughout the year.Attend in-person events on a weekly basis and capture dynamic content to tell the story of our operations, people, and mission in action. QualificationsMust be based in Philadelphia, PA, and have reliable transportation. This job is hybrid!2+ years of experience in social media content creation. Strong understanding of social media platforms, trends, and best practices.Experience creating video content with a focus on dynamic storytelling.Excellent editing skills.Strong attention to detail. Receptive to feedback.Proven ability to measure the effectiveness of social media content.Strong ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Educational background in Marketing, Communications, or a related field is a plus.Experience with graphic design software such as Canva, Adobe Photoshop, or Illustrator is a plus. Please be prepared to submit a creative portfolio. About Sharing ExcessSharing Excess is a Philadelphia-based nonprofit that uses surplus as a solution to scarcity. While over 40 million people in the US face food insecurity, nearly 40% of the nation's food supply is going to waste. By partnering with grocery stores, restaurants, wholesalers, and farmers, Sharing Excess has delivered over 14 million meals to a network of nonprofits, food banks, and community organizations. Our team embraces a fun, fast-paced, agile, and creative startup environment that is laser-focused on improving access to excess and making food a basic human right. If you're passionate about connecting with people, building innovative solutions, and want to make this world a better place, look no further than team SE.

Title: Marketing Coordinator

To include: event communication and promotion; volunteer recruitment, as needed; on-site event support; community engagement activities when appropriate; and other duties, as assigned+Ensure positive correspondence and interaction with both internal and external Organizational constituents to further enhance the quality of relationships developed.Benefits+4 weeks of PTO on an accrual basis in your first year of employment+7 paid holidays (premium pay if scheduled to work the holiday)+Paid sick time+401k with employer match+Medical, dental, and vision Insurance+Employer paid life insurance+Paid training opportunities+Tuition reimbursement plans+Employee pharmacy program+Special employee recognition and giveawaysQualifications+Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or similar field required.+Master’s Degree preferred+Minimum 3 Years Experience In a Related Field Preferred+Strong working knowledge of Social Media Platforms, Adobe Design Suite, Wordpress, Microsoft Office, Google Analytics, and SEO preferred.If you have a passion for service, work life balance, and enjoy working with others, we want to speak with you! Title: Digital Marketing Analyst
Job Description: Join an innovative digital marketing team working across various marketing channels (Paid Search, Display, Re-targeting, SEO/organic, email) using a sophisticated marketing tech stack to achieve business goals. The Digital Marketing Analyst is accountable for managing and developing actionable intelligence and insights to support decision-making for digital marketing channel managers and leadership. This role finds the ‘story’ behind the data – what’s working, what’s not, where opportunities exist, and challenges to be addressed. This is not a remote position and is onsite in Boca Raton, Florida.MDVIP has consistently been recognized as a Great Place to Work® employer since 2018. (Greatplacetowork.com/certified-company/MDVIP) and was named by Fortune and Great Place to Work® as one of the 2021 Best Workplaces in Healthcare & Biopharma™. This is a corporate based role, however a hybrid corporate office and work from home schedule may be available based on position and departmental needs.Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesCreation and Maintenance of Analytics Develops, implements, and manages overarching marketing analytics by working with internal stakeholders to understand data sources, processes and KPIs, and campaign strategies to build dashboards, reports, and tools to help effectively track these measures for outcomes. Analytics Story Telling Collaborates with internal stakeholders to pull the story out of the analytics, moving beyond numbers to what the data is telling us – so that it can be actioned to make impactful business decision making. Analyzes complex data sets to drive awareness, conversion, growth and revenue.Data, Attribution and Reporting Systems Management Serves as the central expert for data, attribution and reporting systems management, with the ability to gather the full story using various analytic systems, while managing the accuracy and accessibility of the data. These include, but are not limited to Power BI, Google Analytics, Salesforce, MS SQL Data Warehouse, and Marketo Analytics.This job profile is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.Education / Experience / KnowledgeBachelor’s degree from four-year college or university, preferably in Marketing, Mass Communications, Statistics/Mathematics or Economics, or equivalent combination of advanced training/education or relevant experience where two years related experience equals one year of schooling.Related experience assumes a similar corporate role focused on Marketing Analytics, Business Analytics or Digital Media Management. Three years marketing experience in a comparable role working in a team environment using a complex CRM application is required.Required Experience and SkillsAbility to communicate complex findings in a structured and clear manner to a non-technical audience.Experience using and managing data visualization / BI reporting tools such as Power BI (preferred) or Tableau to support the creation of actionable analytics.Experience with digital marketing data sources and tools such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, Google Tag Manager, and Google Data Studio.Demonstrated knowledge and experience in data quality concepts, best practices, and tools/technologies.Experience in data management through the utilization of programmatic languages such as SQL, Excel, and/or graphical interfaces through marketing specific technology.Demonstrates good analysis, problem solving and decision-making skills.Thrives in a team environment and demonstrates effective communication and interpersonal skills that enables collaborative working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Has a high functioning ability to understand and learn new technology, systems, or software easily. Has intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office programs.Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple ongoing tasksDesired Experience and SkillsExperience as an active member of a data governance programSufficient technical skills to monitor and challenge the deliverables of IT teams.Good project management skills, to guide data quality improvement projects.Strong technical writing skills, documentation abilities, and ability to create process flowcharts.Experience managing large datasets in different formats such as Excel, Access, SQL database, online sources, data warehouses, etc.Experience with business intelligence, ETL and data visualization platforms such as PowerBI (Preferred), Tableau, Domo, etc. Power BI certificate is highly desired.Additional informationAt no time may work be performed, or computer systems accessed, from outside of the U.S.Individuals hired must be able to perform essential duties satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.MDVIP provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.Consistent with our mission, purpose, and core values, MDVIP takes the health and safety of its employees very seriously. With the concern over the spread of the coronavirus or “COVID-19,”and its variants, MDVIP has, and will continue to take reasonable measures to mitigate the potential spread of COVID-19. Your recruiter will provide more information during the interview process.

relationshipsFluid, effective, and impactful marketing and sales campaigns strategically created and implemented throughout the year while establishing long-term efforts and goals.Solid execution and and sales promotional activities (e.g., social media, direct mail, newsletters, ad campaigns, email, and web).Helping create advertising media, such as print ads, brochures, and displays.Establish and maintain a consistent corporate image throughout all product lines, promotional materials, and events. Mandatory SkillsEffective knowledge of Outlook, Excel, Word and Office products as well as Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop, and, abilities to use the internet for heavy research – MandatorySuperior and effective organization, communications, and detail skills in all aspects of your position and work – MandatoryDesire to grow in the knowledge of Audio Visual (AV) and Virtual and event management environments – MandatoryComplete reliability and timeliness in all aspects of work and performance – MandatoryProvide a positive, upbeat, and “can do” daily attitude with creative involvement and ideas– MandatoryAbility to effectively adjust to daily demands and needs of position – MandatoryAbility to work in a team environment, playing a key role in daily demands – MandatoryQuick and effective ability to use multiple communications effectively and timely including Zoom video/chat, email, phone calls and text with the team, vendors, and clients – MandatoryAbility to recognize and defuse challenges quickly and effectively – MandatoryDisplay great flexibility and approach in daily tasks – MandatoryCustomer service experience - MandatoryProfessional writing abilities – MandatoryDisplay dedication to position, department, team, and company – MandatoryEfficient in working independently in a work-from-home environment holding all accountabilities for work and timeliness – MandatoryAbility to present work and created material to the team, clients, and vendor via conference calls, video conference, other - Mandatory Preferred SkillsBasic to intermediate understanding of social media platforms (i.e., Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn) – PreferredBasic to intermediate knowledge of web design/management (i.e., Wordpress) – PreferredBasic understanding of customer relationship management software – PreferredBasic knowledge of online project management software (i.e., Asana, Slack, Zoom) – Preferred What We Can Offer You: O’Design is a growing company that offers significant career opportunities if you are curious, driven, patient-oriented, and aspire to help us build an amazing company. We work collaboratively, offering you the opportunity to continually learn from your colleagues – even those outside of your area of expertise. Here at O’Design, we are always finding fun ways to make it a great place to work while enjoying and working towards the great possibilities of the future. We are a company with a heart and believe in positively impacting our clients and industry in our pursuit of excellence. O’Design seeks the best employees and works to create an environment where they can thrive, expand their knowledge, and contribute at the highest level. About O’Design Founded by Stephen O’Connor, O’Design Productions and Consulting is the leader in AV management and consulting where daily we are Providing Experience Excellence™ in everything we do. Our team embraces challenges - the more complex, the better. We are laser-focused and know how to prioritize. Job Description: TitleMarketing Coordinator - Content Creation & Events**HomeSafe Alliance**is the single global household goods movement manager of over 300,000 Military Household Goods moves per year for USTRANSCOM and the U.S. Armed Forces, Department of Defense civilians, U.S. Coast Guard, and their families.The**Marketing Coordinator - Content Creation & Events**position will be a member of the Strategic Engagements Team and a typical day will include leading our customer and B2B event marketing strategy and executing successful in-person and virtual events. This role will also support the Strategic Engagements Team in building brand awareness and fostering relationships across our various stakeholder groups. We’re building a program that changes the way the U.S. Armed Forces, Department of Defense civilians, U.S. Coast Guard, and their families relocate, and this role will be a key contributor to that mission.Position DescriptionCreate content for social media posts (event-related and other), blog posts, email copy, presentations, and others as requiredSocial media management/engagementWebsite copywriting & publishingInterviewing customers and creating compelling copy from those interviewsVideo editingPlan, manage, and attend HomeSafe industry and customer eventsLogistics (booth selection, contracts, visuals, lead generation, internal communication, staffing plan, create talking points)Travel up to 20%/approx 1 event/moMarketing content creationParticipate in training, events, and other learning opportunities to stay current on marketing changes, public relations trends, and researchPerform all other duties as assignedQualifications And Skill Requirements5years in marketing and content creation with proven event executionblog posts, emails, social media, white papers, and ad copyB2B experienceCopywriting experience (w/samples or portfolio)Event marketing, communications, and execution (including attendance) experienceStrong communication skills and proven history of working with a variety of departments and stakeholdersAbility to travel up to 20% of the timeLive in close proximity to a major airport to attend events as necessaryPreferredExperience creating products in CanvaBenefitsMedical, Dental and Vision Insurance.Paid time off (PTO) Three weeks of PTO for newly hired employees401(k)Health and Wellness ProgramsDisability, Life and AD&D insuranceEmployee Support programFamily Support: Bright Horizons, child and elder care servicesTeladoc Medical Experts, second opinion programTravel Accident & MedicalTRICARE Supplement PlanVoluntary Benefit PlansAnd more!HomeSafe is an equal opportunity employer. Our team is dedicated to providing fast, easy, and efficient relocation experiences.More than 300,000 military and government households are relocated every year. Coordinating these transfers is a massive undertaking—and we’re proud to say that HomeSafe is positioned to improve the customers’ moving experience. We’re dedicated to making sure that every move is better than the last.We thank you for your service, and for the privilege of serving you in return.**A****t HomeSafe,****We Deliver.****Fraud Alert**Fraud has infiltrated the job placement market via the internet, email and direct phone contact. Title: Director of Marketing & Business Development
Job Description: Aventura Health Group's core value is "Proud to Care." Operated by members who have had that attitude for multiple generations, as children and grandchildren of nursing home operators, Aventura's main focus is to provide a home away from home for residents and staff alike. We are seeking the perfect candidate that will be proud to market and share the message and values.We are proud to Offer:Competitive SalaryComprehensive Healthcare Benefits401k Retirement PlanPaid Time OffOpportunities to advance and grow your careerAnd MoreJob ResponsibilitiesCreate and implement the quarterly marketing/growth plan.Coordinate all internal publicity events and work closely with the Corporate Marketing department on event execution.Develop back up procedure with Administrator for tours when Director of Admissions and Marketing not available.Train back up designees on process of giving tours and taking inquires.Maintain records and results on all referral and conversion activity.In concert with Administrator, provide feedback and perform customer problem resolution.Assist in the development and placement of media advertisements and creative.Serve on Quality Assurance committee for the facility.Ensure that patient and family are appropriately welcomed and settled on admission day.

Title: B2C Marketing Content Specialist
Job Description: About The InstitutesA not-for-profit organization located in beautiful Malvern, PA, The Institutes have been the leading provider of risk management and property-casualty insurance education for more than 100 years. By living our values—Put the Customer First, Do What You Say, Work Together, Be Innovative and Do the Right Thing— our talented team delivers innovative solutions that best empower risk and insurance professionals to help those in need. In 2022, The Institutes were named a Top Workplace by Philly.com for the seventh time. We understand the importance of work-life balance and provide excellent benefits and a friendly and team-focused work environment to drive employee engagement.Marketing Content Strategist B2CThe Marketing Content Strategist is responsible for the development, execution, and optimization of data-driven digital marketing programs in support of growing The Institutes Knowledge Groups’ business with a primary focus on B2C (student) efforts, as well as supporting B2B (corporate) marketing efforts. This role is responsible for creating messaging strategies, marketing strategies to capture, convert and retain students, and for creating meaningful and actionable analysis of program performance. This role also supports enterprise level communications, including media relations. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills are a must.What You’ll Do:Develop and implement strategic digital marketing programs, primarily in support of B2C marketing and enterprise communication programs, with a secondary focus on B2B marketing and sales programs. Establish realistic KPIs focused on business goals, B2C personas, and marketing mix.Develop and implement marketing content in support of B2C, media relations and B2B programs, including the writing of assets.Collaborate with the Marketing team to develop original B2C marketing, including support of product launches and releases, that reinforce core persona messages and value. Tools may include digital outreach, messaging, presentations, and/or meeting and event support.Strategically plan, test, implement, and optimize compelling, innovative and integrated digital marketing and promotional campaignsPartner with stakeholders on enterprise communications to support external and internal awareness efforts, including media relations and thought-leadership messaging.Develop a deep mastery of the customer journey, obtaining insights into everything that helps drive adoption, retention, and advocacyActively track, measure, interpret and optimize results to improve activity and campaign performanceOther Requirements/ResponsibilitiesClosely coordinates activity with marketing and sales counterparts, as well as other stakeholders as neededServe on cross functional teams on an ongoing basisPerforms other duties as assignedRequired CompetenciesThe ideal candidate brings a collaborative and strategic focus to the role. You understand and can translate high level vision and business goals into executable marketing programs. You work well across various departments/teams, understand marketing and stakeholder collaboration opportunities, and have very strong written, verbal and digital communication skills. You have experience with marketing automation systems, marketing analysis, creative process management, and excellent digital content writing skills. You are flexible to meet changing demands and work well under pressure. Experience working with HubSpot and Drupal a plus; marketing writing experience a must.Education & Experience:5+ years practical digital marketing experienceBachelor’s degree required, graduate degree a plusExperience managing vendors/contractors requiredExperience with project management and reportingExperience with marketing analytics and data analysisB2C marketing experience requiredThe Best Part? The Benefits!To enforce the importance of work-life balance, employees enjoy excellent benefits, including:401(k) plan with company contribution up to 16%Generous time off package that includes paid vacation, personal, sick and holidaysPaid maternity and parental leaveTuition reimbursementMedical, dental, vision and prescription coverage

Title: Entry Level Sales and Marketing Assistant
Job Description: G&G Consulting is a marketing and sales firm located in the heart of Jersey Village Houston. We’re one of the fastest growing companies in the area and as we rapidly expand with new clients, we’re looking for Sales and Marketing Assistants to help implement both direct and indirect marketing strategies and assist us in raising brand awareness for our clients’ products and services.This is a full-time position. Our Entry Level Marketing Assistants support us in identifying new market and business opportunities. They will work with our sales and marketing teams to help with marketing, sales, and business development objectives, set long-term strategic goals, cultivate relationships with potential customers, manage existing business accounts, and help lead Entry Level marketing and sales teams as we aim to maximize revenue for our clients.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Identifies and develops a customer base for assigned client(s) both organically and through qualified leads.Responds directly to customer inquiries for information and service requests and works as a liaison between our partners, marketing and sales teams, and management to ensure a high degree of customer and sales support for all marketing programs. Assists the sales and marketing departments in the execution of direct marketing and sales campaigns.Participates in daily sales meetings with the purpose of ensuring that performance goals are being met.Supports the Account Management department by completing other duties as assigned.Attends conferences, seminars, association meetings, etc. as required.Requirements:Experience in a Customer Service, Sales, or Marketing role.A 2-year or Bachelor's degree is highly preferred.Ability to work independently and as part of a teamMust be a self-motivated, confident, and team-oriented individual.Looking for opportunities to advance.Comfortable working in a fast-paced customer-oriented environment on a daily basis. Our firm is looking for someone local to the Houston area that can begin employment within two weeks if offered the position. Powered by JazzHRZfgjDTv3CX

Title: Account Coordinator
Job Description: About UsPlatterz is on a mission to reinvent corporate catering. We're a fast-growing, venture capital backed online marketplace designed to make ordering food exactly the way it should be - easy. Our sophisticated platform allows users to discover delicious meal options from their city’s top restaurants and caterers. Using a customer’s headcount, budget and dietary restrictions, Platterz’s AI-powered solution provides on-demand catering options for corporate lunches, meetings and events.Help us make offices more human.Job SummaryWe're looking for passionate, enthusiastic, outgoing and motivated individuals to join our Los Angeles Account Management team. We're looking for someone who lives and breathes food, has experience working in the food and catering industry, and knows how to share that passion with others and help them have outstanding culinary experiences.What You'll DoConsistently growing and retaining our existing customer baseDevelop and maintain close relationships with our corporate customers, always looking for ways to surprise and delight themFind creative ways to solve our customers' ordering challenges, coming up with delicious food recommendations for them on a regular basisFacilitate on-site lunches and events, ensuring that deliveries arrive on time, and be the point of contact for our customersQualifications And SkillsDegree in related or relative industry experienceProblem Solver who thrives in high pressure situationsOutstanding communication skills - you will be connecting with prospects constantly and you need to be well-spoken and meticulous in your email communicationsAmazing listening skills. It's one thing to talk, it's another to listen. You will need to hone in on what the customer is truly asking for and be able to reflect back.Nice To HavesExperience in Account ManagementExperience with HubSpot or other CRM platformsStartup experienceWorking With Us/PerksWe’re a performance-driven, entrepreneurial team passionate about a job well-done. We embrace learning opportunities, mentorship, creative problem solving, all while having fun with silly inside-jokes. As a food-tech start-up, we promise to keep you full with food from top caterers and restaurants on our platform. We don’t take ourselves too seriously and make sure to balance out challenging days with memorable nights.Weekly breakfast and lunches (we get to try all of our vendors - imagine that!)Fully stocked kitchen: unlimited drinks and snacks.Regular events including game nights, fitness sessions, delicious dinners and more!In office wellness events including stretching, yoga, massages, meditation, etc.Dog-friendly - you can bring your furry friend to work.Team organized sports leagues (baseball, soccer, etc)Multiple yearly company offsitesOne of a kind holiday party!Professional development workshopsCompetitive Benefits PlanAnd many more to come, as we are growing & always innovating!To learn more about us please visit www.platterz.co!Powered by JazzHR

Title: Communications Specialist
Job Description: DCG Communications (DCG) is seeking an organized, detailed, and proactive Communications Specialist to support our federal client. At DCG, we are passionate about our client’s mission to provide world-class healthcare and wellbeing services to honor America's Veterans. If you are a motivated individual seeking an impactful role to improve the health of Veterans, promote policy related to the care of Veterans, and advance Veteran health issues, we encourage you to apply.As a Communications Specialist you will join a dynamic team responsible for delivering general and strategic communications services for our client. Your role will involve planning, creating, updating, and delivering professional communications materials and activities that effectively convey the mission, services, and accomplishments of VHA. The successful candidate will support the Communications Team Lead and will be responsible for writing and editing a wide range of communication materials, including plans, policies, articles, newsletters, news releases, training materials, brochures, interpretive handbooks, pamphlets, guidebooks, scripts, and speeches. In this role, the successful candidate will write and edit various communication materials, ensuring they are clear, concise, and adhere to established guidelines and standards. The Communications Specialist will gather information and develop content that effectively communicates the mission, services, and accomplishments of the VHA. Additionally, the Communications Specialist will assist in presentation preparation and manage records in SharePoint.Location: Remote with occasional travel.Required Experience:Bachelor's degree in English, communications, journalism, or a related field.A minimum of two (2) years of relevant professional experience supporting communications and marketing campaigns, preferably in a communications agency or at local, state, or federal health setting.Excellent writing skills with experience developing and/or editing a variety of communication products, including but not limited to communications plans, policies, articles, newsletters, news releases, training materials, brochures, interpretive handbooks, pamphlets, guidebooks, scripts, and speeches.Strong attention to detail and ability to problem solve and drive outcomes.Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.Outstanding written and verbal communication abilities. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.A passion for improving the health and wellbeing of Veterans. What’s in it for you? DCG prides itself on having a unique and flexible culture. We value hard-working, self-motivated, and dedicated employees and are committed to providing an opportunity for tremendous career growth and earning potential.Company CultureDCG Life Medium Blog: https://medium.com/dcg-lifeDCG Life Instagram: @dcglifeWe offer a comprehensive benefits package to include the following: Market competitive pay.A variety of rich healthcare plans including medical, dental, and vision insurance as well as group life insurance.401(k) retirement with 4% corporate match and immediate vesting upon enrollment.Annual monetary supplement toward mental and physical wellbeing, and pre-tax Flexible Spending Account (FSA).100% Paid Family Bonding for all new parents (including adoption), short-term, and long-term disability. Family planning benefit towards fertility planning and treatment, adoption, and surrogacy.Generous paid time off including 11 paid federal holidays and an annual floating holiday.DCG offers a wide variety of growth and development opportunities such as: internal learning & development programs and professional development for those seeking to further their professional growth.Check out our blog that highlights the benefits we offer to our employees and their families; dive in further to the blog to get a better sense of DCG company culture!About us:DCG Communications (DCG) is a specialized communications consultancy focused on developing influential communications programs to help clients build their brands and enhance their reputations. We work with the federal government, and currently support a number of long-term projects with the following agencies: Departments of Veterans Affairs, Defense, State, Transportation, Homeland Security, Housing & Urban Development, Small Business Administration, and more.DCG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Title: SEO Associate
Job Description: At Launch That, we invest in ourselves and our community. For the third year in a row, we have been recognized as a Top Workplace by the Orlando Sentinel! Launch That was founded in 2007 as an entrepreneurial digital marketing startup that's grown from two founders in a garage to almost 100 digital, tech, creative and content professionals in the heart of downtown Orlando.Launch That covers 100% of the premium cost for employee-only medical coverage for all full-time benefit eligible team members! We also offer 100% employer paid short- and long-term disability insurance, competitive compensation, PTO, 20 days of paid parental leave, a 401k retirement plan, paid volunteer opportunities and more!We work hard and appreciate work/life balance, so all of our team members enjoy a paid company-wide Holiday Break from December 24th - January 1st each year!Check out more about our mission, vision, team, culture, and office at the bottom!About This RoleThe SEO Associate helps drive the marketing strategy for their sites and then helps the team achieve quarterly and annual goals for keyword rankings, web traffic, and leads. Title: Sales and Marketing Coordinator
Job Description: Are you obsessed with health, wellness, and helping people crush their fitness goals? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, get-results-or-die-trying environment? Well, buckle up because StretchLab, the ultimate authority in assisted stretching services, is on the hunt for a brilliant and motivated Sales and Marketing Specialist to join our crew. About StretchLab: At StretchLab, we firmly believe that a bendy body equals a bendy mind and an all-around awesome life. We live and breathe to provide mind-blowing one-on-one and group assisted stretching services that take our clients' wellness to stratospheric levels. Our team of certified Flexologists crafts personalized stretching routines that turbocharge flexibility, mobility, and range of motion, all while giving muscle pain and tension a swift kick in the butt. Salary + Commissions$52k - 75K+ COMPENSATION & BENEFITS: * This position offers very competitive pay Opportunity for bonuses, based on performance * Unlimited growth potential as well within the company.Job Responsibilities: As a Sales and Marketing Specialist at StretchLab, you will play a crucial role in promoting our services and driving business growth. Your responsibilities will include: * Sales Generation: Implementing strategies to increase sales and drive revenue growth. This includes identifying and pursuing new business opportunities, conducting sales calls and consultations, and providing exceptional customer service to convert leads into clients. * Marketing Campaigns: Developing and executing targeted marketing campaigns to raise awareness of StretchLab and attract new customers. This may involve managing social media platforms, creating content, organizing events, and collaborating with local businesses and organizations to form strategic partnerships. * Lead Generation and Follow-up: Proactively generating leads through various channels such as referrals, networking, and online platforms. Following up with potential clients, scheduling appointments, and providing accurate information about our services. * Client Relationship Management: Building strong relationships with clients to ensure their satisfaction and retention. Providing ongoing support, answering inquiries, and addressing concerns promptly to create a positive customer experience. * Sales Reporting and Analysis: Tracking sales activities, analyzing data, and generating reports to assess the effectiveness of marketing strategies and identify areas for improvement. Utilizing insights to refine sales and marketing approaches. Qualifications: To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications: * Proven experience in sales and marketing, preferably in the fitness, wellness, or related industry. * Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport and connect with clients. * Self-motivated and target-driven, with a passion for achieving and exceeding sales goals. * Excellent organizational and time management skills to effectively prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. * Proficiency in social media platforms, digital marketing tools, and CRM software. * Knowledge of local market trends and competitor analysis. * Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as required. Why Join StretchLab: * Opportunity to be part of a growing and innovative company that is transforming the wellness industry. * Competitive compensation package with uncapped earning potential through commissions and bonuses. * Ongoing training and professional development to enhance your skills and advance your career. * Fun and collaborative work environment where your ideas and contributions are valued. * Access to StretchLab's cutting-edge stretching techniques and wellness resources to enhance your own well-being.Founded on the principle of "Live Long," StretchLab is here to shatter the limits of what you thought was possible. We'll help you touch your toes, wave goodbye to tight muscles, and achieve a level of flexibility that would make even the most accomplished yogi jealous. So, join us on this incredible adventure and discover the joys of stretching like never before. Get ready to laugh, sweat, and maybe even let out a few happy tears (don't worry, we won't judge). At StretchLab, we're all about empowering you to live a life filled with movement, vitality, and a whole lot of bendiness. Are you ready to become a stretching superhero? StretchLab is waiting for you!

Title: Communications Coordinator
Job Description: The Institute for Justice, a national public interest law firm, is seeking a proactive and dedicated Communications Coordinator to join our team and play a crucial role in researching, identifying, and distributing news and information related to the areas where our organization focuses its efforts. In this position, you will work closely with our litigation, research, and activism programs, helping to develop and execute effective communication strategies that amplify our impact and reach.As a Communications Coordinator, your primary responsibility will be to gather and analyze relevant news of government abuses to enable the Institute for Justice to concentrate its efforts on the most pressing issues. By diligently researching and staying informed about the latest developments, you will help our organization effectively address injustices and advocate for meaningful change.If you are a motivated individual with a passion for justice and a keen interest in public relations, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of the Institute for Justice and make a difference in the lives of our clients. Your expertise in finding, researching, and disseminating vital information will be invaluable in supporting our mission to promote and protect individual rights and liberties.Primary Responsibilities: Conduct thorough research to gather and compile daily news stories related to IJ, including its cases, causes, reports, attorneys, and clients. Ensure that the most relevant information is distributed effectively.Analyze various media markets to identify key reporters and influencers, targeting them for media outreach efforts to maximize IJ's exposure and impact.Efficiently manage and publish updates to IJ's website, ensuring that the content is accurate, up-to-date, and engaging for the audience.Collaborate with team members to coordinate logistics planning, ensuring smooth execution of projects and events.Occasionally craft compelling press releases, op-eds, and other media documents that effectively communicate IJ’s programs.Meticulously edit media documents, including backgrounders and other materials created by IJ staff, ensuring high-quality content that adheres to the organization's standards and objectives.Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Communications, Political Science or English1-3 years of experience working in a professional office settingExperience working with Microsoft Office and WordPressStrong writing, editing and proofing skillsStrong attention to detail and organizational skillsPersistence, optimism and a congenial attitude Commitment to promoting individual liberty and challenging government abuse Passion for IJ’s missionBenefits: Hybrid work schedule (3 days in-office)Flexible work hours with our core business hours of 10am and 4pm Work from home equipment reimbursement Casual dress code Health, Dental, and Vision insurance (IJ covers 100% of individual premiums) Free Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, and Life insurance plans HSA employer contributions 401(k) with employer matches Generous PTO including a paid personal day and 12 paid holidays  To apply, please submit a resume, a writing sample, and a cover letter explaining what you’d bring to the position.   IJ is an equal opportunity employer.Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At IJ we value a diverse workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.Powered by JazzHR

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.HomeSafe— Delivering Solutions, Changing the World.**HomeSafe has been established to be the premier household goods move management service provider for the U.S. Armed Forces, Department of Defense (DoD) civilians, and their families. Our team is dedicated to providing fast, easy, and efficient relocation experiences.More than 300,000 military and government households are relocated every year. Coordinating these transfers is a massive undertaking—and we’re proud to say that HomeSafe is positioned to improve the customers’ moving experience. As a household goods moving service integrator, we provide earlier visibility into upcoming moves and greater network throughput capacity—ensuring household goods shipments are picked up and delivered on time.With cutting-edge technology and proven logistics expertise, we’re transforming the moving process by continuously evaluating, refining, and improving our tools and techniques. We’re dedicated to making sure that every move is better than the last.We thank you for your service, and for the privilege of serving you in return.**A****t HomeSafe,****We Deliver.****Fraud Alert**Fraud has infiltrated the job placement market via the internet, email and direct phone contact. Attempts have included unauthorized use of HomeSafe’s name and logo to solicit potential job seekers or to extend false job offers. Bad actors may mix in fake job advertisements with legitimate postings. These ads can include contact instructions and require job seekers to send sensitive personal information or money to pay for visa applications, processing fees, etc., in exchange for consideration for a high-paying position.HomeSafe will never ask for any sort of advance payment as part of the recruiting/hiring process. Candidate profiles are carefully managed to protect personal information.BenefitsMedical, Dental and Vision Insurance.Paid time off (PTO) Three weeks of PTO for newly hired employees401(k)Health and Wellness ProgramsDisability, Life and AD&D insuranceEmployee Support programFamily Support: Bright Horizons, child and elder care servicesTeladoc Medical Experts, second opinion programTravel Accident & MedicalTRICARE Supplement PlanVoluntary Benefit PlansAnd more!

Title: Online Marketing Specialist
Job Description: We’re a small, unique sock company based in Portland OR, with a passion for awesome mismatched socks, excellent customer service, and happy employees. We’re excited to create a product that is made in the U.S.A. with recycled yarns, and we pride ourselves on creating a work environment where our employees thrive. We are growing, both on our own DTC website, as well as through a nationwide network of retailers and looking to accelerate that growth. That’s where you come in. We need an online marketing specialist to drive direct-to-consumer sales through online ads and effective support of Amazon.As a small company, we are looking for someone who is accustomed to wearing multiple hats (or socks) and can conceptualize, develop and implement marketing strategies that bring healthy, long-term growth to the business. The perfect fit for us would be someone who is sociable, outgoing, inquisitive, creative and innovative, and brings a spirit of cooperation.Highlights Of The Duties And ResponsibilitiesDevelop and execute marketing campaigns and ad content to achieve revenue and profitability goals. Be willing to adjust strategy and tactics to increase effectiveness.Align online marketing to our overall marketing calendar (primarily advertising schedules and placements, as well as promotion schedules). Manage execution of online ad budget across Meta, Google Ads and Amazon to meet and/or exceed the return on ad spending goals. Develop and implement an SEO strategy to improve effectiveness of our DTC website.Provides analysis, and regular status reports on effectiveness of online marketing programs.The job could either be a full-time or a part-time position based on the experience, skillset and preferences of the chosen applicant.Position RequirementsBachelor’s degree in business, marketing or related discipline, or equivalent experience; with a minimum of 4 years of project management, marketing/communications, ecommerce, and online marketing experience.Experience and strong understanding of ad buying/placement within Meta, Google Ads and Amazon. Demonstrated track record of success.Experience working in Shopify and developing/implementing SEO strategies and tactics within that platformPassionate about marketing, customer experiences, and socks! Must have product-based online marketing experience, and specific experience within footwear, sock or apparel companies is preferred.Strong writing skills and the ability to nuance communication are a must Working knowledge of graphic design for print and webStrong affinity for excellent customer serviceExcellent time management & prioritizationSoftware: MS Office (particularly Excel), Adobe InDesignBasic HTML knowledge is a plusSolmate is a hybrid work environment with the expectation of 3 days/week in the Portland office.Solmate Socks offers health care benefits, paid time off, 7 paid holidays, paid volunteer time off, life insurance, a 401(k) employer match up to 5%, and employee discounts to all full-time employees, along with competitive salaries based on experience. This job is located in our Portland, Oregon office.CALL TO ACTION: If this resonates with you and you are interested in getting to know us more, we would love to hear from you. To apply, please include a resume AND a cover letter to tell us a few things about yourself. Feel free to be candid, you can be as detailed or simplified as you wish! We think cover letters say more about a candidate than resumes.Solmate Socks is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against otherwise qualified applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, mental or physical disability, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender orientation or expression, marital status or veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic under applicable federal or state law.

Title: Associate Marketing Manager, Avalon Travel
Job Description: ASSOCIATE MARKETING MANAGER, AVALON TRAVELReports to VP, Associate PublisherLocation: Berkeley, CAAvalon Travel, the publishers of Rick Steves and Moon Travel Guides, is hiring a Marketing Associate Manager who recognizes the importance of brand marketing and the value of book publishing.Our ideal candidate is a creative problem solver and strategic thinker who can plan, execute, and analyze brand and title marketing campaigns large and small. We are seeking a strong writer with excellent organizational skills to join our small, collaborative team. We are headquartered in Berkeley, CA and work on a hybrid schedule with Tuesdays and Wednesdays in the office. With some team members working remotely across time zones, good communication habits are key.THE PERSON IN THIS POSITION WILL:Conceptualize, execute, and analyze results-driven marketing campaigns targeting diverse audiences within set budgets; a typical campaign incorporates a mix of digital advertising, social media, influencer marketing, and content marketingManage strategy and coordinate content for some consumer-facing platforms and marketing programs which may include some of Moon’s social media channels, moon.com, or roadtripusa.comReport on results and learnings from campaigns and managed platformsParticipate in marketing meetings and brainstorming sessions around campaign ideas, branding, and strategyCreate sales materials and optimize metadata for assigned titles in collaboration with team members, including writing descriptive copy, fact sheets, one-pagers, ads, and other collateral in line with our brand style guidesCommunicate professionally with authors, coworkers, and internal and external marketing partnersSKILLS OR KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE:Experience working in consumer-facing marketing, advertising, or publicity, though book marketing experience is not required. Familiarity with digital advertising is ideal and Amazon advertising is a plus. This is not an entry-level role. Interest in non-fiction/reference book publishing is essential but having a degree or being well-traveled is not!Strong writing skills and communication habitsAn aptitude for experimentation, comfort assessing data and willingness to adjust or reassess based on results. Social media fluency and etiquetteHELPFUL BUT NOT REQUIRED:Knowledge of Canva, Wordpress, Braze, Google AnalyticsExperience creating content for and/or managing brand social mediaInterest in representing Moon on camera in video content and possibly at virtual or in-person conferences and events Prior publishing experience We strongly encourage people from underrepresented or unconventional backgrounds, and/or those historically excluded from publishing to apply. If you are self-taught or not certain that you’re 100% qualified, please consider applying regardless. We whole-heartedly believe skills are transferable and software can be taught! As a trans- and enby-inclusive team, we also encourage candidates to use their chosen name and pronouns if comfortable doing so.How to ApplyTo be considered, please submit both a resume AND a cover letter. We ask for a cover letter so that we can understand how your skills or experience can apply to our space in travel reference publishing. Unconventional experience including personal projects/content creation, zine administration, or bragging about your extremely well-curated Pinterest boards, etc. are all very welcome.As a leading book publisher, we believe that including and representing diverse voices in all aspects of our business is fundamental to what we do. Our publishing programs must reflect the broad range of backgrounds, experiences, political views and ideas that shape our society and publish books for all readers.Hachette Book Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.The compensation range for this position is $56,000-$60,000. Salary can vary based on a number of factors including skills, experience, and location — talk with your recruiter to learn more. There may be times that you will be required (or requested) to work overtime due to the nature of your role or exceptional workload issues or special projects.The following benefits are offered by the company: medical, dental, vision, basic and supplemental life, short-term and long-term disability, accidental death and dismemberment, critical illness, hospital indemnity, long-term care, health and dependent care FSA, commuter benefit plan, employee assistance program, tuition reimbursement, travel assistance, 401(k), discretionary bonus program, PTO (15 vacation days, 2 personal days, 10 holidays and generous sick leave) and group discounts on auto and home insurance and legal services. Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification, hours worked and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms.

Title: Americas Developer Marketing & Programs
Job Description: About UsAt Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!What You'll DoCloudflare is seeking a dynamic and innovative Developer Marketing Lead to join the Americas marketing team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing marketing strategies and initiatives targeted specifically at developers. Your primary goal will be to engage and empower developers to adopt and utilize Cloudflare products and services. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including global developer marketing, product management, engineering, and sales, to drive developer adoption, increase product awareness, and ultimately contribute to Cloudflare’s mission to build a better Internet.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies to target and engage developers around Cloudflare’s “Workers” development platform, including creating compelling messaging, campaigns, and content across various channels.Understand developer personas, their needs, pain points, and motivations to develop effective marketing initiatives.Build and maintain strong relationships with developer communities, influencers, and key stakeholders.Partner with the global developer marketing lead to design engagement strategies and programsEstablish & leverage partnerships with complementary technology providersInfluence and champion content and program needs to engage the developer audienceOrganize and participate in industry events, conferences, and meetups to promote Cloudflare products and services to developers.Drive developer engagement and adoption of Workers through online and offline activities, such as hackathons, workshops, meet-ups, hands-on labs, etcConduct market research and competitive analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and best practices for developer marketing.Track, analyze, and report on the performance of developer marketing initiatives, including KPIs, ROI, and engagement metrics. Required Skills & ExperienceMinimum 5 years of experience managing developer programsEstablished relationships with developer oriented media properties such as Slashdot, DevOps.com, StackOverflow, etc.Ability to effectively influence both internal and external stakeholders A passion for Cloudflare’s mission and the success of our customers, partners, and community.Excellent planning, project management, prioritization skillsStrong data-management skills and analytical skills to analyze campaign effectiveness and ROIDeep curiosity, excellent listening and empathy skillsPositive and flexible attitude for working in a fast-paced environment and ability to build strong relationships across various departments and functionsCompensationCompensation may be adjusted depending on work location.For Colorado-based hires and Washington hires: Estimated annual salary of $ 108,000 - $ 132,000. For New York City-based and California (excluding Bay Area): Estimated annual salary of $ 115,000 - $ 141,000. For Bay Area-based hires: Estimated annual salary of $ 122,000 - $ 149,000 .EquityThis role is eligible to participate in Cloudflare’s equity plan.BenefitsCloudflare offers a complete package of benefits and programs to support you and your family. Our benefits programs can help you pay health care expenses, support caregiving, build capital for the future and make life a little easier and fun! The below is a description of our benefits for employees in the United States, and benefits may vary for employees based outside the U.S.Health & Welfare BenefitsMedical/Rx InsuranceDental InsuranceVision InsuranceFlexible Spending AccountsCommuter Spending AccountsFertility & Family Forming BenefitsOn-demand mental health support and Employee Assistance ProgramGlobal Travel Medical InsuranceFinancial BenefitsShort and Long Term Disability InsuranceLife & Accident Insurance401(k) Retirement Savings PlanEmployee Stock Participation PlanTime OffFlexible paid time off covering vacation and sick leaveLeave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical, and bereavement leaveWhat Makes Cloudflare Special?We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost. Athenian Project  : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

Title: Digital Acquisition Marketing Specialist - Pet - Remote | WFH
Job Description: Ignite Your Career with an Exciting Opportunity!At our dynamic and innovative company, we're the driving force behind 20+ renowned health, beauty, and pet care brands that generate over $1 billion in revenue annually. Our passionate team of employee-owners is committed to creating top-notch products that revolutionize the direct-to-consumer market and empower individuals to live their healthiest, happiest lives. Now, we're seeking a talented Digital Acquisition Marketing Specialist to join our ranks and make a significant impact on our ad campaigns across native and paid social platforms.As a Digital Acquisition Marketing Specialist, you'll take charge of the entire campaign cycle, from crafting engaging ads and conducting performance tests to determining budgets, launching campaigns, and overseeing their success. Dependents receive 75% premium coverage.Become an Owner: Join our Employee Stock Ownership Plan and become a valued part owner of Golden Hippo.Boost Your Savings: Maximize your retirement savings with a generous 401K Plan, including a company match of up to 3.5%.Stand Out, Get Rewarded: Excel in your role and receive recognition through our KPI Bonus, Win of the Week, Spot Bonus, and Shoutouts Program.Flexibility at Your Fingertips: We offer flexible work arrangements for most positions, allowing you to achieve work-life balance.Skyrocket Your Career: Unleashyour full potential with unlimited opportunities for professional growth within our organization.Thrilling Events Await: Be a part of exciting virtual and in-person events that redefine fun and foster team spirit.Competitive Compensation: Earn a competitive annual salary ranging from $68,300 to $91,100, with additional monthly KPI bonus potential based on your experience and performance.Join our vibrant team where A-players thrive and make a lasting impact on the direct-to-consumer industry. Take the next step in your career and seize this exhilarating opportunity by applying today!Employment Type: Full-TimeSalary: $ 68,299.00 91,100.00 Per Year

Title: Junior Marketing Communications Assistant

Title: Marketing Specialist
Job Description: DescriptionPosition at Structure ToneMarketing SpecialistStructure Tone New Jersey is looking for a Marketing Specialist to work in a fast-paced, team environment based out of our Woodbridge office. We are looking for a creative and driven professional who provides a full range of high-level support for the firm’s proposal and presentation needs. The position requires strong attention to detail and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects to meet deadlines. The ideal candidate will embrace the opportunity to promote our exciting projects in creative ways, bring new ideas to the table, and grow with the company as a leader.This position requires proficiency in InDesign, Illustrator, and PowerPoint and experience in the A/E/C industry.The Ideal Candidate Will Ensure we deliver a strategic, high-quality submission for proposals and presentations Coordinate proposals, qualifications packages, and presentation materials including project descriptions, project approaches, logistics plans, descriptions of services, cover letters, resumes, and organizational charts Create and customize templates to improve the efficiency and look of our client submittals Create and customize project documents to meet RFP/RFQ requirements Once the RFP is won, maintain, and create new material for our website and other marketing/communications vehicles, document project progress with photography and video, contribute to brand identity development and implementation, maintain brand standards Establish and maintain effective and collaborative working relationships with senior management and marketing team Candidate must be confident and proactive (but also professional) interacting personally with senior management and team members to get what they need (meet deliverables, etc.) Thrive in a fast-paced environment and effectively handle multiple time-sensitive requestsQualifications & ExperienceWe are looking for a motivated, strategic thinker with excellent problem-solving skills. Conscientious and flexible, the ideal candidate will demonstrate integrity, a positive attitude, and be a team player.We are looking for a confident, proactive professional with experience interacting personally with senior management and team members to get what they need and meet deadlines. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to adapt to different communication styles are required as well as an ability to work calmly and efficiently to produce quality, error-free work. Great attention to detail is a must! Bachelor's degree in marketing or communications, graphic design or related field is required. A minimum of 3 years of marketing experience within the architecture, engineering, or construction industry is desired. A minimum of 3 years of experience within a B2B marketing department A. or B.S. in related field of study Proficient in Adobe Suite and PowerPoint Familiarity with Salesforce and Cosential or other similar CRM systemsThe STO Building Group family of companies—Structure Tone, Structure Tone Southwest, Pavarini Construction Co., Pavarini McGovern, LF Driscoll, Govan Brown, Ajax Building Company, BCCI Construction, Layton Construction, Abbott Construction, and RC Andersen—includes over 4,000 employees located in offices throughout the US, Canada, UK, and Ireland. We provide a complete range of construction services, from site selection analysis, design constructability review and aesthetic enhancements to interior fit-outs, new building construction, and building infrastructure upgrades and modernization. Learn more about how we partner with our clients to imagine, execute, and realize their vision at stobuildinggroup.com.We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Marketing Coordinator
Job Description: Portland Rescue Mission, is seeking a Marketing Coordinator. This gifted servant will personify organization, communication, and teamwork as they join a Christ-centered team with an award-winning culture and a commitment to serving others.Are you ready to make a lasting difference as you share the story of people finding hope and life restoration? If so, we invite you to thoughtfully consider this unique opportunity.EMPLOYMENT DETAILSHow to apply: We ask all applicants to apply through the Portland Rescue Mission online application form found on our careers page: https://portlandrescuemission.hiringthing.com/Status: Full-Time, Regular, Non-ExemptReports To: Director of MarketingHours: Monday-Friday, 8-5, other evenings and weekends as needed, Location: Administration Office (13207 NE Halsey St. Portland, OR)THE MARKETING TEAMThe Marketing Department at Portland Rescue Mission (PRM) is a group of dedicated professionals using their marketing skills to raise provision for life-restoring Christian ministry by excellence in fund raising and brand enhancement through direct mail, digital, social media, tele/radio-thons, media relations, and advertising support for PRM’s social enterprises. Our goal is to tell the stories of what God is doing in the lives of the people we serve with integrity and excellence. In doing this, we honor the lives of those we serve and share their testimony in a way that invites others into partnership with PRM through service, prayer, and financial support.THE POSITIONThe Marketing Coordinator contributes to the efficient functioning of the Marketing Department by supporting the Marketing Communications Manager. The scope of responsibility ranges from project management, resource gathering, digital support, event coordination, and content creation. The right candidate will organize and execute the administrative tasks of the team with a customer-service attitude and will also have strong communication and writing skills.The EssentialsDeadlines for ongoing marketing projects will be professionally supported, using Basecamp, tactical meetings, and one-on-one meetings with a focus on accuracy, timeliness, and claritySeasonal events including telethons, radiothons, and other special events will be coordinated and supportedPRM’s brand narrative of Giving Hope and Restoring Life will be promoted by writing strategic and compelling content PRM supporters will be encouraged, educated, and motivated by well-crafted content across all our digital and social platforms in collaboration with the Digital Content Specialist and the Marketing Communications ManagerPRM supporters will be encouraged and ministered to by compelling and engaging blog content highlighting stories of life-restoration, job openings, volunteer profiles, and PRM’s social enterprisesThe Marketing Department and their partnering vendors will have a steady influx of new stories including interviews and pictures that support seasonal themes and appealsThe Director of Marketing will be free to focus on strategic leadership, knowing the Marketing Coordinator is providing reliable, detail-oriented administrative and project support for the Marketing Department including expense reports, vendor management, and customer serviceGeneral FunctionsCreate and maintain administrative systems for the Director of Marketing and the Marketing DepartmentCommunicate with appropriate parties for event and project coordinationSupport the Digital Content Specialist in the production of digital, social media, and blog contentWork closely with other departments to ensure that our marketing efforts prioritize the recovery process of participants, and that the departments are supported and equipped to accomplish their goalsUpdate and maintain the Marketing Department’s materials library to ensure most current information and materials are easily available to all appropriate staffParticipate in staff meetings as requiredAssist in general Marketing Department projects including events, video & photo shoots, and activitiesServe a minimum of two hours per week in a direct ministry role at one of PRM’s locations by providing compassionate care to the people served in PRM’s programsBackground And QualificationsCollege degree in related field or experience equivalentMarketing workplace experience preferred, especially in a cross-functional team environmentProficient in Microsoft Windows software, especially Word and ExcelExperience with project management software such as Basecamp and related CRM systemsExcellent communication skills, both verbal and writtenProfessional, warm, and friendly demeanorStrong ability to identify and self-manage necessary tasksAdvanced organizational abilitiesA personal relationship with Jesus Christ as Savior and a testimony of continued growth in faithSpiritual maturity as defined by traditional Biblical StandardsAdheres to PRM's Statement of Faith and Code of EthicsDesire to serve God in the ministry to hurting men, women and childrenEQUIPTMENT USEDTelephone, fax and voice mailComputer and databasesCopier and related office equipmentProject management systems (Basecamp 3)MISSION AND DISTINCTIVESOUR PASSIONTo exalt Jesus by cultivating transformed livesOUR UNIQUE APPROACHFrom the first sandwich that was shared in 1949, to today's fully integrated emergency, recovery, and training services, Portland Rescue Mission is a highly relational ministry. The Mission builds supportive and caring communities, meets people at their point of need, equips them, and provides a path forward. In-depth partnership with churches and volunteers, multiple tiers of services and a focus on growing Christian disciples is fundamental to Portland Rescue Mission’s success.

Title: Marketing Coordinator - Content Creation & Events
Job Description: TitleMarketing Coordinator - Content Creation & Events**HomeSafe Alliance**is the single global household goods movement manager of over 300,000 Military Household Goods moves per year for USTRANSCOM and the U.S. Armed Forces, Department of Defense civilians, U.S. Coast Guard, and their families.The**Marketing Coordinator - Content Creation & Events**position will be a member of the Strategic Engagements Team and a typical day will include leading our customer and B2B event marketing strategy and executing successful in-person and virtual events. The Marketing Coordinator will create content to support those events, create social media content, and tackle ad hoc marketing projects to support HomeSafe’s success. This role will also support the Strategic Engagements Team in building brand awareness and fostering relationships across our various stakeholder groups. We’re building a program that changes the way the U.S. Armed Forces, Department of Defense civilians, U.S. Coast Guard, and their families relocate, and this role will be a key contributor to that mission.Position DescriptionCreate content for social media posts (event-related and other), blog posts, email copy, presentations, and others as requiredSocial media management/engagementWebsite copywriting & publishingInterviewing customers and creating compelling copy from those interviewsVideo editingPlan, manage, and attend HomeSafe industry and customer eventsLogistics (booth selection, contracts, visuals, lead generation, internal communication, staffing plan, create talking points)Travel up to 20%/approx 1 event/moMarketing content creationParticipate in training, events, and other learning opportunities to stay current on marketing changes, public relations trends, and researchPerform all other duties as assignedQualifications And Skill Requirements5years in marketing and content creation with proven event executionblog posts, emails, social media, white papers, and ad copyB2B experienceCopywriting experience (w/samples or portfolio)Event marketing, communications, and execution (including attendance) experienceStrong communication skills and proven history of working with a variety of departments and stakeholdersAbility to travel up to 20% of the timeLive in close proximity to a major airport to attend events as necessaryPreferredExperience creating products in CanvaBenefitsMedical, Dental and Vision Insurance.Paid time off (PTO) Three weeks of PTO for newly hired employees401(k)Health and Wellness ProgramsDisability, Life and AD&D insuranceEmployee Support programFamily Support: Bright Horizons, child and elder care servicesTeladoc Medical Experts, second opinion programTravel Accident & MedicalTRICARE Supplement PlanVoluntary Benefit PlansAnd more!HomeSafe is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.HomeSafe— Delivering Solutions, Changing the World.**HomeSafe has been established to be the premier household goods move management service provider for the U.S. Armed Forces, Department of Defense (DoD) civilians, and their families. Our team is dedicated to providing fast, easy, and efficient relocation experiences.More than 300,000 military and government households are relocated every year. Coordinating these transfers is a massive undertaking—and we’re proud to say that HomeSafe is positioned to improve the customers’ moving experience. As a household goods moving service integrator, we provide earlier visibility into upcoming moves and greater network throughput capacity—ensuring household goods shipments are picked up and delivered on time.With cutting-edge technology and proven logistics expertise, we’re transforming the moving process by continuously evaluating, refining, and improving our tools and techniques. We’re dedicated to making sure that every move is better than the last.We thank you for your service, and for the privilege of serving you in return.**A****t HomeSafe,****We Deliver.****Fraud Alert**Fraud has infiltrated the job placement market via the internet, email and direct phone contact. Attempts have included unauthorized use of HomeSafe’s name and logo to solicit potential job seekers or to extend false job offers. Bad actors may mix in fake job advertisements with legitimate postings. These ads can include contact instructions and require job seekers to send sensitive personal information or money to pay for visa applications, processing fees, etc., in exchange for consideration for a high-paying position.HomeSafe will never ask for any sort of advance payment as part of the recruiting/hiring process. Candidate profiles are carefully managed to protect personal information.BenefitsMedical, Dental and Vision Insurance.Paid time off (PTO) Three weeks of PTO for newly hired employees401(k)Health and Wellness ProgramsDisability, Life and AD&D insuranceEmployee Support programFamily Support: Bright Horizons, child and elder care servicesTeladoc Medical Experts, second opinion programTravel Accident & MedicalTRICARE Supplement PlanVoluntary Benefit PlansAnd more!
