Title: Event and Marketing Coordinator - Remote | WFH
Job Description: At our university, we are dedicated to empowering student success and transformation. University Career Services (UCS) plays a vital role in achieving this mission by providing personalized and innovative career education. Our vision is to guide UNC-Chapel Hill students towards purposeful and prosperous lives that align with their goals.University Career Services focuses on educating students about career development and management processes, teaching essential competencies for success, and fostering connections between students and employers. We collaborate with faculty, employers, and other departments across campus to create a vibrant ecosystem that supports student development.Position SummaryAre you passionate about creating exceptional experiences and connecting talented individuals with career opportunities? As the Event and Marketing Coordinator, you will play a pivotal role in managing and coordinating engaging events, implementing effective communication strategies, and supporting administrative functions such as record-keeping, financial data management, and customer support. In this position, you will be responsible for orchestrating over 10 career fairs annually, including payment processing and expense management. Utilizing various communication mediums, such as digital and printed graphics, social media, our website, email, and our career services management platform, you will ensure all stakeholders are well-informed about our exciting events.Minimum Education And Experience RequirementsWe are seeking candidates with a bachelor's degree in business administration or a related discipline, or an equivalent combination of training and experience. All degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions.Required Qualifications, Competencies, And ExperienceAre you an excellent communicator, both orally and in writing? We need someone who can explain complex information and processes with clarity and ease.Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and possess exceptional time management skills? We are looking for someone who can prioritize tasks under pressure and meet critical deadlines, all while multitasking effectively.Building relationships is essential to our success. We need someone with outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships.Attention to detail and accuracy are crucial in this role, as you will be responsible for reliable record-keeping and problem-solving within system and policy guidelines.Proficiency in using MS Office is a must, along with experience in utilizing multimedia design technologies for effective communication.Familiarity with applicable procedures and information systems to communicate and organize events is highly desirable.Preferred Qualifications, Competencies, And ExperienceMaintaining confidentiality is crucial, as you may handle sensitive matters in this position.Are you a master planner with exceptional coordination skills? We value individuals who can oversee multiple tasks and ensure seamless execution.Knowledge of websites, graphic design, and social media applications will be advantageous in this role.Possessing a valid Driver's License is preferred.Special Physical/Mental RequirementsCampus Security Authority ResponsibilitiesIn accordance with the Clery Act, this position is designated as a Campus Security Authority. You will be required to report Clery crimes to the Clery Compliance Manager and participate in annual training regarding reporting responsibilities.Special InstructionsQuick LinkJoin our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact on the lives of students! We're currently seeking an enthusiastic and talented Event and Marketing Coordinator to join our university's Career Services department. In this temporary role, you'll have the opportunity to showcase your organizational skills, creativity, and passion for connecting students with exciting career opportunities.As the Event and Marketing Coordinator, you'll play a vital role in coordinating and managing a wide range of engaging events. From career fairs to networking events, you'll be responsible for ensuring these experiences are both memorable and valuable for all participants. You'll also be at the forefront of our communication efforts, utilizing various channels such as social media, our website, and email to share information and build excitement about upcoming events.To succeed in this role, you'll need exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to explain complex information in a clear and engaging manner. Your strong time management and organizational abilities will enable you to thrive in a fast-paced environment, where you'll juggle multiple tasks and meet critical deadlines with ease. Building strong relationships with students, employers, and other stakeholders will be key, as you'll collaborate with various teams across campus to ensure our career services are top-notch.If you have a bachelor's degree in business administration or a related field, along with experience in event coordination, marketing, or student services, we'd love to hear from you. Proficiency in MS Office and multimedia design technologies will be highly valued, as will your knowledge of online platforms and social media applications. Most importantly, your passion for empowering students and helping them achieve their career goals will make you a perfect fit for our team.This is a full-time temporary position, offering a competitive hourly rate. We're committed to creating a positive work environment, and we offer a flexible work arrangement that may include partial remote work options. If you're ready to make a difference and embark on an exciting career journey, apply today and join us in shaping the future success of our students!Employment Type: Full-TimeSalary: $ 21.00 21.00 Per Hour

Title: Director of Office of Communications & Community Engagement
Job Description: PrintSubscribeClass TitleDirector of Office of Communications & Community EngagementClass Code5784Salary$152,588.80 - $199,888.00 Annually+Definition+BenefitsClassification Description SummarySummary DescriptionUnder general administrative direction, plans, directs, manages, and oversees the activities and operations of the Office of Communications & Community Engagement, including citizen participation, citizen service call center, public relations, media relations, advertising, and marketing; coordinates assigned activities with other departments and outside agencies; and provides highly responsible and complex administrative support to the Assistant City Manager and City Manager. practices.Assume full management responsibility for all services of the Office of Communications & Community Engagement and activities including citizen participation, citizen service call center, administration of the department budget; approve the forecast of funds needed for staffing, equipment, materials and supplies; approve expenditures and implement budgetary adjustments as appropriate and necessary.Provide support and advice to City departments, City Manager, City Council and the Mayor regarding internal and external communications, media relations, marketing, advertising and citizen relations and citizen participation.Analyze the communications and marketing needs of the City to assess annual long-term budgetary requirements.Develop proactive programs and procedures to educate the public, positively influence public opinion and make citizens better informed voters.Develop crisis and emergency response communication programs for such situations as fires, industrial accidents, natural disasters, major crimes and aircraft crashes; modify programs as required to ensure efficiency.Prepare City staff for the conduct of press conferences, media events, interviews and editorial boards; maintain awareness of regional and national issues and their effect on City operations.Oversee marketing, advertising and video production operations for the City; develop marketing concepts and plans and requests for proposal; administer marketing and advertising contracts for City enterprises.Work with City staff in analyzing specific departmental communication needs and developing strategic communication plans and programs to meet those needs.Create and implement, in collaboration with the City Manager's Office, an internal communications plan focused on sharing information with employees and collecting information from them.Provide staff assistance to the Assistant City Manager and City Manager; prepare and present staff reports and other necessary correspondence.Represent the Office of Communications & Community Engagement to other departments, elected officials and outside agencies; coordinate assigned activities with those of other departments and outside agencies and organizations.Explain, justify and defend department programs, policies and activities; negotiate and resolve sensitive and controversial issues.Participate on a variety of boards, commissions, and committees.Attend and participate in professional group meetings; stay abreast of new trends and innovations in the field of public relations and communications; incorporate new developments as appropriate.Respond to and resolve difficult and sensitive citizen inquiries and complaints.Perform related duties as required.Minimum QualificationsThe following generally describes the knowledge and ability required to enter the job and/or be learned within a short period of time in order to successfully perform the assigned duties.Knowledge OfOperations, services and activities of a comprehensive public communications and community engagement program.Principles and practices of public communications, marketing and advertising.Advanced principles and practices of program development and administration.Methods and techniques of strategic communication planning.Principles, practices and aspects of media relations.Methods and techniques of contract negotiation and administration.Principles and practices of municipal budget preparation and administration.Principles of supervision, training and performance evaluation.Pertinent federal, state and local laws, codes and regulations.Ability ToManage and direct a comprehensive public communications program.Develop and administer departmental goals, objectives and procedures.Analyze and assess programs, policies and operational needs and make appropriate adjustments.Identify and respond to sensitive community and organizational issues, concerns and needs.Plan, organize, direct and coordinate the work of lower level staff.Delegate authority and responsibility.Select, supervise, train and evaluate staff.Analyze problems, identify alternative solutions, project consequences of proposed actions and implement recommendations in support of goals.Research, analyze and evaluate new service delivery methods and techniques.Develop crisis and emergency response communication programs.Develop strategic communication plans and programs to meet City needs.Provide community outreach programs aimed at increasing citizen understanding of City operations.Oversee marketing and advertising operations for the City.Prepare clear and concise administrative and financial reports.Prepare and administer large and complex budgets.Interpret and apply applicable federal, state and local policies, laws and regulations.Work in a team based environment to achieve common goals.Coordinate multiple projects and complex tasks simultaneously.Meet the physical requirements to safely and effectively perform the assigned duties.Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.Establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.Environment: Work is performed in an office and field setting with some travel to attend meetings, interact with media at incident sites; occasional work in inclement weather and in an emergency environment; extensive public contact; exposure to computer screens and other media equipment. Incumbents may be required to work extended hours including evenings and weekends.Physical: Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting; to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time; to occasionally stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, reach, and twist; to lift, carry, push, and/or pull light to moderate amounts of weight; to operate office equipment requiring repetitive hand movement and fine coordination including use of a computer keyboard; to travel to different locations; and to verbally communicate to exchange information.Other RequirementsA43JD 11/2018Please use this Health and Welfare Benefit Link (http://www.reno.gov/government/departments/human-resources/benefits)to learn more about the City of Reno's great employee benefit plans and wellness programs.SubscribePlease verify your email address Verify Email

Title: Marketing Excellence Specialist
Job Description: Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team as Global Marketing Excellence Specialist to help tell our story to labs, patients and providers in films.Our global team: We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.Our culture: We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers.This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Global Marketing Excellence Specialist, you will be responsible for:Setting the strategy for execution of growth activities by the marketing organization and its members through simplified structures and processes, fast decision making, and trial and error learning. Optimize the marketing organization: deliver marketing-function excellence by aligning marketing strategy with business and zone strategy, build strong governance, strengthen marketing tools and operations, and foster a culture that encourages innovation and agility. Measure and improve marketing performance: work with marketing teams to set key success metrics, leverage analytics to assess results, and translate insights into impact. Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders across multiple business lines and zones to define and execute detailed marketing plans in line with business strategy. Act as liaison between commercial teams, marketing, and marketing operations to ensure effective triage of leads and follow-up. Conduct marketing surveillance for competitive intelligence and industry trends. Communicate with stakeholders across the organization to support effective collaboration and alignment on launch activities. Capture key progress metrics along program/launch readiness timeline and communicate regularly and effectively this progress, highlighting areas of success and risk. Address challenges and remove obstacles to meet key launch execution milestones. Lead debriefing and learning activities to support optimization for future programs and/or launches. This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers Excellent strategic project management skills, with the ability to organize and communicate complex data. Superb stakeholder management: ability to lead across multiple business lines and zones. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills. Attention to quality in all initiatives. Experience working in a regulated environment. Showcases curiosity and open mindset towards new ways of doing things. Demonstrates the Growth Mindset and is able to take ownership of personal development and growth. Capable of constructively challenging the status-quo and takes risks to challenge internal and external perspectives. Required skills to have for the success of this role Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field. 5+ years’ experience in life sciences or medical device setting. Prior launch experience required. Experience leading complex, cross-functional initiatives in a matrixed environment. Exceptional oral and written communications skills. Experience managing global projects and building relationships and rapport across functions and markets. Demonstrated success applying skills in change management, including building consensus, influencing, and effectively supporting colleagues in the timely completion of deliverables and tasks across stakeholders. Fluent with project management tools (MS Project, Asana) and general office tools (PowerPoint, Excel). Knowledge of operations and commercial practices in the medical device industry. Willingness to travel up to 20%. A proven track record of conceptual creative ability and judgment. The ability to work collaboratively with creative and marketing teams. Excellent presentation skills. Excellent PC skills (MS Office software like Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook). Willingness to travel up to 20%. The pay range for this position is $107,000.00 - $148,000.00 annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The annual incentive target is (10%) of base pay. Siemens Healthineers offers a variety of health and wellness benefits including paid time off and holiday pay.   Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://benefitsatshs.com/index.htmlThis information is provided per the required state Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Siemens Healthineers external or internal careers site.At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose: To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.Beware of Job ScamsPlease beware of potentially fraudulent job postings or suspicious recruiting activity by persons that are currently posing as Siemens Healthineers recruiters/employees. These scammers may attempt to collect your confidential personal or financial information. If you are concerned that an offer of employment with Siemens Healthineers might be a scam or that the recruiter is not legitimate, please verify by searching for the posting on the Siemens Healthineers Career Site.If you want to join us in transforming the way healthcare is delivered, visit our career site at https://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/careers.If you wish to find out more about the specific before applying, please visit: https://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/about.“Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US export control law.” “It is Siemens Healthineers’ policy to comply fully and completely with all United States export control laws and regulations, including those implemented by the Department of Commerce through the Export Administration Regulations (EAR), by the Department of State through the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), and by the Treasury Department through the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctions regulations.”As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.Equal Employment Opportunity StatementSiemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.EEO is the LawApplicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. Title: Product Marketing Manager (Warehouse)
Job Description: Körber is the home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do. Entrepreneurial spirit is our joint DNA. We develop future technologies and support talents to deploy their skills and reach their full potential. We combine our strong heritage with our understanding for local specifics and a global mindset to bring people together and create valuable solutions for our customers. We aim for being the first to do the right thing at the right time.Join the home for entrepreneurs!As the Product Marketing Manager you will have the opportunity to help define, own, and drive the go-to-market positioning and messaging for several of our warehouse-focused supply chain software solutions. You will develop the positioning and messaging efforts, product content development and sales enablement for your products. In this role, you will be a key link between Product, Marketing, Sales and Management.Your Role on Our TeamYou will be an integral part of the high-energy Portfolio Marketing teams, and will work closely with sales enablement, content marketing and corporate communications to globally scale our leading portfolio of warehousing solutions across industries You will become the expert for your products, markets and target audiences; through primary and secondary market research, competitive analysis and engagement with SME, customers and executives You will own and develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates your solutions and can be scaled globally. Title: Temp - Coordinator, Merchandise
Job Description: Job Description:At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we know that each talent makes our collective bolder and brighter. We are guided by four core principles that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses:Music is Everything: Music is our passion, and we can never get enough. Tastes, trends, and tech will change, but great artists and songwriters will always be our driving force.Global Growth, Local Expertise: Music is a global language. Through communication and collaboration, our success can come from anywhere and translate everywhere.Innovation and Insight: Pushing the boundaries requires the best information and the boldest imagination. We use both to create the future.Empowered by People: Like the artists we serve and the music they make, our differences make us stronger. This is a place where every talent can belong and build a career.We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity.Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.A little bit about our team:The Artist and Fan Experiences team at WMX works alongside our labels to service the merchandise rights for our Artists. The team looks after both the Artists brand but also the fans interaction and experience. Primarily focused on merchandise we handle touring, e-commerce, VIP, retail and licensing globally for hundreds of Artists. Primarily focused on Atlantic and Elektra music group we will work closely with management and artists in developing strategy and execution to help in maximize opportunity and sales for our acts.Your role:The Coordinator supports the Atlantic and Elektra merchandise division. They will help the product managers in creation of the product lines and aiding in the development/execution of merchandise for all channels (tour, retail, e-commerce and licensing). The role will own full development and execution of marketing merchandise for our label groups as well as helping the Product Managers in executing our merchandise roll out and strategy through all the channels.Here you’ll get to:Assist the product managers across all elements of the merchandise business up to and including:Creating tour order sheetsTour announce and summary emailsOne Sheet creationsSales reportsOverseeing marketing orders and promotional ordersRunning market analysis on our competitors merchandise and VIP experienceProduct and E-commerce set upCreating Artist one sheets and presentationsOverseeing shipping and logistics on tour supply actsAbout you:You are a motivated team playerYou are able to provide as well as receive feedback and directionYou are a quick thinker and able to problem solve on the flyYou are an effective communicatorYou have excellent time management, follow-up, and organizational skills with ability to prioritize workload, and a strong attention to detail.You are self-motivated, able to work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines.You enjoy working in a fast paced, dynamic environment and embrace changeWe’d love it if you also had:3+ years experience as a Coordinator or Assistant5 years experience working cross-functionally within a larger teamProficient in MS Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook)Bachelor's degree, from an accredited college or university preferredAbout us: As the home to 300 Elektra, Asylum, Atlantic, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Redefining what it means to be a music company in the 21st century, our consumer brands include trend-setters like UPROXX, Songkick, HipHopDX, and EMP. We’re the home to WMX – the next generation services division that connects artists with fans and amplifies brands in creative, immersive, and engaging ways – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels.Together, we are Warner Music Group: Music With Vision & Voice.Love this job and want to apply?Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. Title: Channel Program Marketing Associate
Job Description: JELD-WEN is currently seeking a Channel Program Marketing Associate to join our growing team.Job Description Job Title:  Channel Program Marketing Associate Reports To:  Channel Development Manager – ProgramsOur CompanyJELD-WEN (NYSE:JELD), founded in 1960, is one of the world’s largest door and window manufacturers, with more than 21,000 employees operating in 24 countries globally. Headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina, JELD-WEN designs, produces and distributes an extensive range of interior and exterior doors, wood, vinyl and aluminum windows and related products for use in the new construction and repair and remodeling of residential homes and non-residential buildings.Our products and services afford us the opportunity to enter peoples’ workplaces, homes and daily lives. With this privilege comes great responsibility to ensure that the products we deliver are reliable and enrich the places and lives that they touch. We bring beauty and security to the spaces that touch our lives.We act with integrity, invest in people, inspire through innovation, deliver on our promises and improve every day. We are seeking talented individuals who share this purpose and values and want to excel in their field of expertise. We offer excellent benefits, a collaborative environment in which to apply your talent and a dynamic and growing company, with exceptional career progression opportunities. THE ROLE The Channel Program Marketing Associate is a key player for developing, executing, measuring, and improving the marketing programs within the traditional channel while ensuring maximum visibility and engagement across sales and our channel partners. The scope of this role includes developing, executing and maintaining all marketing programs, promotions and project-based initiatives that ultimately drives mutual profitability, revenue, and brand loyalty.The Channel Program Marketing Associate will track and provide analytics for promotional activities and functions, develop data driven metrics to measure ROI, Key Performance Indicators and make recommendations on the findings.Principle Duties And Responsibilities In collaboration with enterprise marketing team, works with Channel Development Manager to launch and refine valuable channel programs that motivate and excite channel partners that build brand loyalty, create brand advocates, and drives revenue  Analyze, measure, and assist with implementation of improvement for channel programs and promotions  Tracks, maintains, and reports accurate analysis of program results with stakeholders  Proactively assesses, clarifies, and validates program needs and makes recommendations that attract customers that succeed over the competition to win business  Effectively communicates and promotes initiatives to maximize sales potential to channel partners and internal stakeholders  Manages and owns program budgeting, forecasting, assets, and inventory including but not limited to brand store items related to programs, co-op tracking, any/all activities to close loop and reconcile marketing funds internally and externally  Works with functional teams on planning, communication and execution of successful program launches with both existing and newly activated partners.  Communicates and refines program documents for internal stakeholders and channel partners to clearly identify benefits, terms and conditions, rules of engagement, marketing collateral, etc. that supports programs launch and sustainability.  Collect VOC from members and manage feedback for continuous improvement, thus maintaining “Best in Class” programs.  Investigate emerging trends and competitive landscape and share insights to keep us ahead of the competition  Make recommendations to marketing team to help evolve identify and understand needs of key influencers/personas (consumers, contractors, builders, and architects) and develop tools and programs that make it easier to do business and drive results.  Maintain and improve external and internal relationships, manage resources, and assigned projects  Develop program analytics tied to goals and measurement plans to gauge success of program initiatives and ensure appropriate investment is profitable.  Travel required 10% Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Proficient computer skills required including Microsoft Office Suite  Demonstrate successful ability to build positive partnerships and work collaboratively with cross-functional business teams  Ability to think strategically with supporting analytical skills  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization.  Strong organizational skills and attention-to-detail with the ability to multi-task and prioritize well in a fast paced, dynamic work environment  Ability to adapt to change with creative innovative solutions while adhering to tight deadlines on budget.  Proven ability to negotiates with vendors and services for best arrangements within budget  Must be a high-energy, motivated self-starter Education And Experience Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business administration or related field.  1 year channel marketing, program, events, and sales negotiation work experience.  Competency in project and stakeholder management.  Building products and manufacturing industry a plus.  Experience in B2B marketing, preferred. JELD-WEN is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.Unless explicitly requested or approached by JELD-WEN, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services .Who We AreHeadquartered in Charlotte, NC, JELD-WEN is a leading global manufacturer of high-performance interior and exterior building products, offering one of the broadest selections of windows, interior and exterior doors, and wall systems. JELD-WEN delivers a differentiated customer experience, providing construction professionals with durable, energy-efficient products and labor-saving services that help them maximize productivity and create beautiful, secure spaces for all to enjoy. The JELD-WEN team is driven by innovation and committed to creating safe, sustainable environments for customers, associates, and local communities. The JELD-WEN family of brands includes JELD-WEN® worldwide; LaCantina™ and VPI™ in North America; Swedoor® and DANA® in Europe; and Corinthian®, Stegbar®, and Breezway® in Australia.In 2022, Newsweek named JELD-WEN as one of America’s Most Trustworthy Companies.What We OfferInvesting in People is one of our Core Values, we strive to attract & retain great people! As such, JELD-WEN offers competitive compensation & benefits packages. As a global organization, specific benefits may vary, however typically including medical & dental, generous leave policies, retirement program, etc.JELD-WEN is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.JELD-WEN does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services.

Title: Marketing Associate
Job Description: DescriptionRIVA Solutions is seeking a Marketing Associate with a background in public sector marketing to join the Marketing and Communications (MarCom) team. The ideal candidate will have 3-5 years of marketing experience and a proven track record of success in driving business growth and brand identity within the federal IT contracting sector.MUST BE LOCAL TO THE GREATER D.C. AREAThis individual must be skilled in developing and executing strategic marketing initiatives that drive business growth and increase brand awareness. Our ideal candidate is an emerging leader with a passion for creating engaging content and fostering meaningful connections with target audiences. Candidates must possess strong customer service and communication skills.Candidates familiar with the GovCon industry who have worked in a similar capacity at another government contractor or services provider are preferred. This position is remote-first, candidates must live within an hour of the DC Metro region to attend events and occasional in-person meetings.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and execute marketing strategies and campaigns aimed at expanding our presence in the federal IT contracting market, including the creation of marketing materials, digital marketing initiatives, and events. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, solutions, and client delivery to ensure marketing efforts are aligned with company goals and objectives. Assist with marketing operations and project management to ensure timely and efficient execution of marketing initiatives, coordinating with cross-functional teams to prioritize tasks, allocate resources, monitor progress, and maintain a strong focus on quality and results-driven outcomes. Create and maintain a comprehensive content calendar to plan, organize, and manage content production and distribution across various channels, ensuring a consistent and engaging brand presence while optimizing content for maximum audience engagement and reach. Write and develop compelling content tailored to target audiences, including blog posts, articles, whitepapers, case studies, social media copy, and email campaigns, ensuring clarity, consistency, and adherence to brand guidelines while effectively conveying key messages and driving engagement. Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify new market trends and understand customer needs. Build and maintain strong relationships with key industry partners, influencers, and stakeholders, including government agencies, prime contractors, and industry associations. Develop and implement SEO strategies to improve organic search rankings, drive targeted traffic, and increase website visibility, focusing on keyword research, on-page optimization, technical SEO, and high-quality backlink acquisition. Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and trade shows, as well as through webinars, social media, and other digital channels. Track and analyze marketing campaign performance and recommending adjustments as needed to optimize results.QualificationsBachelor’s degree in marketing, Business Administration, or a related field. 3-5 years of marketing experience, with a focus on Federal IT contracting. Proven track record of developing and executing successful marketing campaigns, with demonstrable results in driving business growth. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information to diverse audiences. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions and recommendations. Proficiency in marketing automation tools, CRM platforms, and other relevant technologies. Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously, while maintaining a strong attention to detail.Preferred Qualifications: Prior experience working in government contracting or professional services organization. RESULTS. INNOVATION. VALUES. ACCOUNTABILITY.That’s RIVA. Our employee-first approach has manifested a culture that attracts the best and brightest. By investing in people firsts, and providing a flexible work environment, our employees have higher moral, higher productivity rates, and lower turnover. At RIVA, people are our #1 priority.RIVA Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any protect class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please email [email protected]. Only messages left for this purpose will be returned.

Title: Marketing Assistant
Job Description: Are you looking for a new best friend, card-game companion, or gardening guru? Then consider working with one of our light, bright, and beautiful Assisted Living and Memory Care communities - where our residents are #1 and our team members shine!Marketing AssistantFrontier Management is seeking an outstanding Marketing Assistant to join The Preserve at Woodland Hills Assisted Living & Memory Care community located in Woodland Hills, California. Demonstrated success as a leader in similar settings is required of the Marketing Assistant.Position qualifies for a Performance Based Bonus Program! See below for more detail.Frontier Management's portfolio of communities spans throughout the United States with each community sharing a commitment to superior service and quality lifestyle for our residents within their own unique setting. Frontier's mission is to provide an enriched and meaningful experience for our residents, team members, and community partners. If you are as committed and passionate about serving the needs of our senior residents as we are, we encourage you to apply and experience the Frontier Difference.The Marketing Assistant is responsible for coordinating all on-site sales and move-in efforts under the direction of the Marketing Director. The position will be a crucial resource for successfully supporting seniors and families who are seeking our services as well as ensuring a smooth move-in process. The Marketing Assistant must possess a high level of customer service, self-motivation, and a compassion for Seniors.Primary Duties and Responsibilities:Conducts initial and/or follow up contact with prospective residents and family members, to include phone calls, walk-ins, and requests for information received through the mail or web-based. Assembles all appropriate collateral material for mass mailings, individual correspondence, information packets, floor plans, etc. Follows up on requests for information from current prospects and disseminates information approved by the Executive Director. Maintains database in Lead Tracking (ALF) Nurtures relationships with new and existing prospects to provide a continuation of referrals and to sell the services provided by, including but not limited to Independent Living, Assisted Living and Memory Care senior living. Implements marketing strategies as instructed by the Executive Director and Marketing Director. Assists with the implementation of the marketing plan, which includes participation (as needed) through all phases of the marketing process, special events, promotional strategies, community relationships, presentations, etc. Participates in all areas of marketing activities that are needed to achieve goals set by the Executive Director. Handles mailing of letters, forms and collateral materials, as appropriate in response to the needs of prospective residents and their families. Maintains database of contacts and referral sources in sales software. Completes required forms and follows all procedures deemed necessary to keep database current. Answers phone inquiries. Responds in writing and by e-mail as necessary. Attends and participates in appropriate in-service and department meetings. Generates correspondence as necessary with prospects, and their families, as required to maintain and nurture relationships. Performs clerical duties and assignments deemed appropriate by the Executive Director, including assisting with the completion of required resident documents prior to move in. Other Requirements:High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor’s degree in Marketing preferred. Two years of Senior Living experience preferred. Must possess excellent leadership and communication skills, be creative, fun loving and have a caring disposition towards the elderly. The Marketing Assistant must also have a current driver’s license Typing and marketing skills and have a neat, professional, courteous manner and appearance. Ability to pass drug screen and Criminal background check. Willing to work shift assigned, weekends, and holidays. Ability to work independently with minimum supervision; problem solving, conflict management, budgeting. The Marketing Assistant qualifies for a Performance-Based Bonus Program! Frontier Management, LLC has an established Performance Based Bonus program for our community’s Marketing Assistant that incentivizes diligent efforts and outcomes, which positively impact the Company and its future, by striving to control costs, maintain high levels of resident satisfaction and reaching high census targets.Frontier Management offers a competitive salary and a work environment that encourages initiative and fosters respect. Frontier Management, LLC offers medical, dental, vision, life/AD&D, Flexible Spending Account, Short Term Disability, Accident Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance, and Hospital Indemnity Insurance. We also offer a 401(k) plan with a competitive Match program. To discover more about the Frontier Management team, please visit our site at www.frontiermgmt.comEqual Opportunity Employer/ Drug-Free Workplace

Title: Director of Marketing
Job Description: Director of Marketing/ AdmissionsDo you have a background in health care sales and marketing? If you enjoy working with seniors and their families to secure the best care for a post-acute stay, consider the role of Director of Marketing at The Laurels of Kent!The Director of Marketing manages the facility’s census by developing and maintaining positive relationships with hospitals, physician groups, community organizations and insurers.Laurel Health Care Company offers one of the leading employee benefit packages in the industry, including health insurance, 401K with matching funds, paid time off and paid holidays. Title: Marketing & PR CORE Position
Job Description: This is a seasonal year-round position in the Marketing Division with responsibilities that include building a media library through photo and video content for the park. Title: Sports Minded Marketing Associate
Job Description: Sports Minded Marketing Associate *Competitive Sports Fans/Players Wanted for an immediate start in Culver City*Stark is a full service sales & marketing agency in the heart of Culver City, LA. We’re currently hiring the next wave of people that have what it takes to learn quickly, earn consistently and grow personally & professionally into a productive member of our Marketing Leadership and Management Team!In all the markets we've worked in, we’ve found that people who have a competitive nature & winning mindset tend to excel in this opportunity!We’re interested in meeting people that have experience in: sports, athletics or other competition that kept scorehealth, fitness, personal training, coachingteam work, leadership roles, captain titlesthe military or other structured routine requiring disciplineany organized activity requiring commitment and dedication(no specific work experience, qualifications nor education are required)Stark focuses on developing and enhancing people’s individual talents and strengths. We also nurture their competitive nature and willingness to lead others in order to achieve more as a team. We provide the platform for those looking to stand out and excel in the field of sales, marketing, business or entrepreneurship, but it’s up to you to do the rest!We believe that the success of any business comes down to the people that work there, and the leadership core within the organization. At the heart of any good organization lies good people… and we want to find more of them here in LA!We build our leadership core and management team by promoting from within. We’ve built a powerful organization because all new starts begin in an entry level field marketing & sales role and progress based on their results. This fosters a strong management team because we’re never asking anyone to do something we haven’t done ourselves! This helps leaders lead by example instead of preaching theory! We know that with the right mentality and the right actions, everyone that starts with us can get from an entry level position into a management position in under a year. Only the strongest and most competitive actually make it though!We pride ourselves in providing our team with:A productive, competitive and fun work environment Ongoing support and guidance from your mentors Public recognition and praise for getting resultsBonuses and incentives plus uncapped earning potential Regular networking and leadership seminars Weekly team nights or team building activitiesInvites to black tie events and live sporting events Travel opportunities including international trips (when & where applicable)If you think you have what it takes to become our next top performer, (and you’re over 18 years of age), we’d love to hear from you! Please click to complete the online application process. ** Please note; all applicants should have the appropriate VISA to work in the US and be able to start relatively soon in Culver City, LA. Due to the high number of qualified people looking for work in the region, we will not be able to hold spots for those hoping to relocate once they find work **

Title: Training Coordinator CGH
Job Description: Job DetailsLevelExperiencedJob LocationMain CampusPalatine, ILRemote TypeN/APosition TypeFull TimeEducation LevelBachelors degree |DSP Trainer|3YR AutismSalary RangeUndisclosedTravel PercentageLocalJob ShiftMixedVarious HoursJob CategoryNonprofitSocial ServicesDescriptionIMPORTANT:During the coronavirus COVID-19 pandemic we will remain open and continue hiring since we are an essential service provider as a Human Service Organization.How To ApplyOption 1: Complete this Online ApplicationOption 2: Quick Review > Email: recruiter@littlecity.orgSubject Line: Open Position: Training CoordinatorAttach: Resume / Cover LetterNOTE: If job link does not work please visit our website for this & other positions >>> www.littlecity.org/careers/PURPOSE:As a key member of the ChildBridge Center for Group Home Living (CGH) management team, the Training Coordinator is responsible for training and developing proficient skills for children’s residential staff, including but not limited, staff who provide direct services and supports with youth and young adults ages 10 to 22 years who have severe autism, intellectual and developmental disabilities (I/DD). The position will design, develop, and implement integrated classroom, virtual, and direct real time training and coaching to meet the needs of the CGH and evaluate the effectiveness of such training. Provides individual and group coaching with staff when debriefing after unusual or crisis incidents during evening and weekend hours.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Trains and coaches’ children’s residential staff developing their competency skills individually and in groups to achieve skill mastery. Trainings will include classroom-based, virtual, and on-the-job in the residential environments when staff are working directly with youth and will determine most effective training methods. Trainings will include, but not limited to, active engagement, healthy behavioral practices, and other Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) principles.Ensures trainings are based on evidence-based practices and adheres to certified training methodologies.Completes training implementation fidelity and staff competency assessments in real time and role play formats.Collaborate with Training Department to implement and monitor staff competency training dashboards identifying training needs of individual staff as well as patterns for programmatic training needs.Assists with onboarding training including helping staff meet required On-the-Job-Trainings (OJT).Lead formal debriefing after unusual and crisis incidents and collaborates with the home leadership on identified training needs.Responsible for designing, writing, and completing training manuals and supplemental training materials, when directed. Assist in compiling and updating training procedures manuals. Select or develop teaching aids such as instructors guide, participant materials, visual aids, etc.Formulate training plans and determine appropriate small- and large-group instructional methods, such as self-study, individual training, on-the-job training, mentoring, computer tutorial, group instruction, role play, lecture, demonstration, conference, meeting, workshop, and other methods. Create and maintain program documentation.Recommend program enhancements and prepare “refresher” programs. Conduct programs and refreshers in a timely manner.Evaluate employee program participants. Concentrate on employees’ receptiveness and comprehension to the presentations’ material. Communicate observations and make recommendations to managers in order to assist in improving employee work habits and job knowledge, as needed.Remain current in training and development methods, techniques, and trends. Read relevant publications and attend necessary seminars. Remain current on agency products, services, and activities.Evaluates overall effectiveness and efficiency of training programs being taught to ensure an effective transfer of skills/knowledge to staff. Compile and analyze data and prepare narrative and statistical reports of program effectiveness.Provides crisis management when available during working hours as needed.Assist Home Manager ensuring staff members are following and implementing the schedule through direct observation and random checks.Collaborates closely with the clinical team and the case managers when individualized training is needed on skill-acquisition.Collaborates with the Assistant Director of Quality Improvement to complete an inventory of Ukeru pads and protective equipment.Attends department meetings and other meetings as required by supervisors.Maintains a current American Heart Association certification in First Aid and CPR. CPI, and Ukeru.Successfully completes Little City Foundation required training, re-training, and any additional training as required by Little City Foundation policies and practices, or as assigned by his or her immediate supervisor. Actively participates in any professional development opportunities, as appropriate.Completes all other professional duties as assigned by supervisor.QualificationsMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:A Bachelor’s degree in education, human resources development, management, staff development, or a human services field or at least 4 years serving as an instructor/educator conducting adult training, required. At least 3 years of experience working in the field of autism, intellectual and developmental disabilities and/or with individuals with emotional and behavioral challenges, required. Must be eligible to be a Direct Support Professional (DSP) (OJT) trainer. Experience with Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) preferred. Proficient computer skills with Microsoft Office products. Preferred certification to teach Crisis Prevention Intervention (CPI). Required to obtain CPI and Ukeru crisis management trainer certifications when train-the-trainer trainings are available. Strong analytical skills for needs assessments and development of effective program evaluations. Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, and facilitation skills. Able to communicate and work collaboratively with all levels of Little City. Must possess strong empathy skills in working with diverse backgrounds.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORK ENVIRONMENT:While performing the duties of this job, the employee is subject to sitting, walking, and standing for prolonged periods; frequently pushes, pulls, grasps, feels, and occasionally stoops, kneels, crouches, or crawls. The employee frequently is required to use manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination when working with persons served and handling office, medical, or household equipment. The employee is subject to assist and lift up to 50 pounds with varying amounts of assistance on a reoccurring basis. The employee is required to have corrected vision and hearing within normal range and the ability to operate a motor vehicle. Must have the ability to perform CPR and CPI. Occupational exposure to blood, body fluids, infectious substances, including communicable diseases when performing personal care (Category III). Occasional exposure to cleaning agents and disinfectants. Residential work environment with a noise level of normal to loud. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Disclaimer: The intent of this job description is to provide a representative level of the types of duties and responsibilities that will be required of positions given this title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description.

Title: Events, Marketing & Recruitment Coordinator
Job Description: DetailsOpen Date 05/11/2023Requisition Number PRN34939BJob Title Study Abroad AdvisorWorking Title Events, Marketing & Recruitment CoordinatorJob Grade DFLSA Code AdministrativePatient Sensitive Job Code? NoStandard Hours per Week 40Full Time or Part Time? Full TimeShift DayWork Schedule SummaryRegular business hours, Monday through Friday 8 am-5 pm. Occasional nights and weekends may be required. After a successful probationary period, this position will be eligible for a hybrid telecommuting/in-office schedule.VP Area Academic AffairsDepartment 02213 - LA - General AdminLocation CampusCity Salt Lake City, UTType of Recruitment External PostingPay Rate Range 46000 to 48000Close DateOpen Until Filled NoJob SummaryThis position manages all event planning and recruitment, and coordinates with the Office of Global Engagement ( OGE ) on outreach and marketing efforts.This position leads and organizes Learning Abroad events, including, but not limited to, the Learning Abroad Fair, faculty-led program recruitment events, new student orientations, external marketing events, inter-office trainings, and other programming as assigned. This position collaborates with the Office of Global Engagement ( OGE ) Marketing team on the marketing side of events planning and champions the Global U brand.Within the Office for Global Engagement, Learning Abroad serves as the central study abroad office for both the Salt Lake City campus and Utah Asia Campus in Incheon, South Korea. We send approximately 700 students abroad annually in a variety of majors, participating in faculty-led, affiliate, exchange, and Utah Asia Campus programs. Our operation is growing; over the past few years, pre-pandemic, the number of students learning abroad increased by an annual rate of 15%.The University of Utah is the state's flagship institution of higher education, with 18 schools and colleges, more than 100 undergraduate and 90 graduate degree programs, and an enrollment of more than 32,000 students. In 2019, the university joined the Association of American Universities, an invitation-only, prestigious group of 65 leading research institutions marked by excellence in academic expertise and research impact, student success, and securing resources in support of core missions. The U is a member of the Pac-12 and is a Tier I Research Institution.Salt Lake City provides convenient access to both natural recreation (excellent hiking/biking trails, seven world-class ski resorts, five National Parks) and a thriving culture scene (modern downtown, fine dining, theatre, ballet, music, visual arts, museums, sports, and more). Combined with the region's strong economy and dynamic growth, Salt Lake City offers a high quality of life.Excellent benefit package including tuition reduction program, generous leave accrual, free transit pass, generous retirement with immediate vesting, & flexible health plan options. Relocation assistance available.Anticipated start: As soon as possibleResponsibilities Develop and implement Learning Abroad recruiting events and activities. Effectively promote Learning Abroad as a scholarly activity that builds transferable skills. Uses a variety of innovative media and forums in an effort to increase participation and diversity in Learning Abroad programs. Coordinates and manages relationships with partners on and off campus to facilitate processes, improve opportunities, foster collaboration, and increase efficiency. Monitors best practices and trends in the field to enhance team success and stakeholder experiences. Collaborates directly and often with OGE Marketing Team to develop and update digital and print materials, including flyers, social media posts, campaigns, emails, etc. Works under the guidance of OGE to design a long-term strategic marketing plan for Learning Abroad. Manages Learning Abroad website, in partnership with OGE Marketing and IT. Ensures that the look and feel of software complies with institutional branding. Email correspondence as directed by Manager’s as needed. Filing, faxing and distribution of incoming/outgoing mail.Answer telephones/emails to assist internal and external guests with requests.Shift Pattern: Mon-Fri, 40 hours but may require flexibility based on hotel needsPay rate: $11.75 per hourWhat are the benefits of working for Hilton?*Hilton is proud to support the mental and physical wellbeing of all Team Members so they can Thrive personally and professionally in a diverse and inclusive environment, thanks to innovative programs and benefits such as:Go Hilton travel program: 100 nights of discounted travel Access to your pay when you need it through DailyPay Hilton Shares: Our employee stock purchase program (ESPP) - you can purchase Hilton shares at a 15 percent discount! Title: Junior Client Relations Associate
Job Description: Property Works, is a full-service facilities maintenance company. We are looking for a Junior Client Relations Associate aids the Client Relations Associate (CRA) to cultivate long-term, trusting relationships with our customers. The Junior Client Relations Associate’s role is to aid the CRA in overseeing a portfolio of assigned customers, develop new business from existing clients, and actively seek new sales opportunities. Junior Client Relations Associates answer client queries and identify new business opportunities among existing customers in the absence of the CRA & with assistance from experienced team members. This position may require occasional travel. If you are familiar with account management software (CRM), have a flair for client communication, and understand consumer behavior, we’d like to meet you. Ideally, candidates for this role will know how to meet ambitious individual and team-wide sales quotas. Ultimately, a successful Junior Client Relations Associate should collaborate with our sales team to achieve quotas while keeping our clients satisfied and engaged with our products and services in the long run.Responsibilities:Serve as the second point of contact for all customer account management matters. Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships. Learn to Negotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profits. Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives. Develop new business with existing clients and/or identify areas of improvement to meet sales quotas. Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts). Prepare reports on account status. Collaborate with the sales team to identify and grow opportunities within a territory. Assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed. Salary + Commission:Base Salary of $35,000/annuallyRealistic expectations within 12-18months would be $100,000/annuallyProperty Works is the industry leader in scholastic, municipal, and commercial facilities maintenance work. We're also a no-nonsense, drug-free workplace. A background check, drug test & motor vehicle record will all be checked, if any of these pose an issue, please do not apply. Growth is highly valued in our organization, complacency will not be tolerated.

Title: Project Manager
Job Description: PROJECT MANAGERUsing cutting edge tools and technology, TOCCI’s team builds great projects and takes pride in doing well. Combining effort with resources, we improve communities at home and globally. Consider joining our team If you want work to mean more than a paycheck. Read more about the Sr. Project Manager position.RESPONSIBILITIES	Maintain an excellent relationship with primary stakeholders through accurate and timely communication	Participate in Pre-construction Planning: develop project goals and objectives; analyze constructability; staffing; and risk planning; subcontractor selection guidelines; mobilization and logistics plan; and set up of all project management protocols and systems	Assure Contract Compliance: Assure project team understands contractual obligations. Monitor compliance throughout the project 	Develop and Manage Schedule: including Master and 3-week Look Ahead. 	Manage Documentation and Reporting: set-up  documentation and reporting protocols and systems. including Submittals, RFIs, and Monthly Progress Reports	Manage Cost: participate in Purchasing and Buyout. Coordinate with Accounting to manage Requisitions and Payments. Control Changes and Claims. Run and analyze cost reports using data to drive profitability	Manage Close-out: Procure the last payment, assure Zero Claims, and facilitate quality control.	Oversee Warranty Period: Manage issues related to warranty and guarantee claims 	Meetings: Lead Owner meetings and participate in all other project meetings as a leader, facilitator, or key contributor	Develop Assistant Project Mangers/Engineers on your team	Effectively communicate with all levels of the organizationDESIRED SKILLS + EXPERIENCE	Bachelor of Science in civil engineering, construction management, architecture, or equivalent. Commitment to on-going professional development	Experience: 10+ years project management in commercial construction on projects valued $20m+	Excellent written and verbal communication skills	Ability to produce accurate and on time work under changing priorities and deadlines. 	Decisive: makes decisions to expedite the project	Strong relationship building skills promotes client trust	Desire to serve the needs and goals of the team	Strong capabilities in MS office, Procore, Scheduling and Performance of the required duties will require physical ability to negotiate outdoor work areas under construction where the noise level is moderate to very loud. This is a general statement of required major duties and responsibilities performed regularly. ABOUT TOCCITocci suburban Boston HQ is in a 19th century mill building that blends old-world charm with contemporary design. Tocci provides a supportive business environment, competitive salary, and excellent benefits package. Tocci is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Direct Marketing & Promotion Specialist

Have signature approval from current supervisor (note: may be declined due to business conditions within the existing department).WHAT TO SEND OUR WAYYour resume, highlighting your education, experience, and skillsWhy you want to be a part of the Galls familyWhat We OfferExcellent medical/dental and vision coverage— Eligible 1st day of the month after start date401(k) retirement plan with company contribution (because you will retire someday)Flexible benefits—choose what you like, ignore the restGenerous employee discountVacation and Personal TimePaid HolidaysTuition reimbursementDaily Pay- Receive up to 50% of wages for hours worked DAILY!!! Title: Proposal & Marketing Specialist
Job Description: Control Point Associates is seeking an energetic, ambitious, self-motivated Proposal & Marketing Specialist with 3 – 5 years of experience in the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (A/E/C) industry to join our team in Warren, New Jersey. This person will lead proposal development with the support of management, research and communicate upcoming opportunities, respond to requests from teaming partners, and maintain proposal archives and firm information. We are looking for a problem-solver with creativity, a good eye for layout, and attention to detail, who can stay organized while responding to tight deadlines in a dynamic team environment.Essential Functions+Support the lifecycle of marketing pursuits, from strategy and win planning to proposal preparation, including developing, writing, and editing Statement of Qualification's , proposals, prequalification forms, and other business communication documents, and interview preparations.+Complete government forms, client questionnaires, and qualifying statements as required.+Gather information needed to propose (technical approach, project pages, resumes, insurance, etc.).+Initiate, write and maintain: Project descriptions for use in proposals; bios/resumes on firm personnel.+Produce and/or oversee production of all materials required for proposals.+Editing and review of all technical documentation provided by other company team members.+Maintain and research avenues for notification for bids/RFPs.+Contact companies regarding teaming requests.+Quality control review of key materials developed by the department.+Attend pre-bid meetings and bid openings.+Facilitate Kick-Off Meetings with Branch/Project Managers.+Obtain pricing from both Branch/Project Managers.+Compile all data into accurate and organized presentations for RFP submission.+Continuously evaluate and identify opportunities to drive process improvements that positively impact the customer’s experience.+With the Client Development Manager, create and maintain Accredited presentations, lunch and Learn deliverables, attendance recording, certificates, and catering orders.+Assist the marketing team and maintain a strong relationship with Marketing Manager and Marketing Coordinator. Simple graphic design editing/topic research. Give ideas from project pages/resumes to translate to social media. Set up booth and attend regional conferences.+This includes learning multiple booth configuration set-ups, develop new business conversations, gather contact information from booth visitors, and understanding/selling our services.Knowledge, Skills And Abilities:+3+ years of proposal-writing experience in the A/E/C industry.+High energy, captivating written communicator.+Understand, meet, and exceed deliverable requests.+Strong writing and editing skills (including grammar and punctuation).+Exhibit persistence and follow-through on commitments and deadlines.+Ability to execute across a wide variety of internal and external marketing activities, including proposal preparation and trade show/conference booth setup.+Proficient with Microsoft Office products.+Detail-oriented, customer-centric focus, elite problem-solving skills, and solution orientated.+Willingness to work overtime if needed.+Multi-tasking and the ability to meet deadlines as well as adjust to changing priorities.+Collaborative and the ability to build and work across all levels of the organization as well as with contractors, suppliers, vendors, and the public.+Basic understanding of Adobe Suite, email marketing software, Hootsuite or other social media publisher.We offer a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, company paid life insurance, 401K with company match and generous paid time off. Company provided breakfast twice a week, lunch once a week, a holiday party that cannot be beat, and a visionary atmosphere with a familial and jovial culture.If your skills and drive match exactly what we’re looking for, then apply to the Proposal & Marketing Specialist opening in Warren, NJ today!! We look forward to working with you!Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group.Powered by JazzHR

Title: Junior Marketing & Sales Representative
Job Description: New Age Marketing, a progressive marketing firm in the Charlotte area is hiring an Entry Level Junior Marketing & Sales Representative. We take the time to develop and train the individual, level by level to handle any task and take initiative on any campaign, which is why we do not require experience in marketing and sales to be a part of our team.We do, however, require highly motivated, proactive individuals that are seeking a career and not just a job. We are looking for a competitive individual to fill an entry-level opening on our Marketing & Sales team as a Junior Marketing & Sales Representative. This position is entry-level with advancement opportunities and involves marketing and sales where customers come to us!Our firm prides our-self on being a company that always puts clients and culture first!Benefits of the Junior Marketing & Sales Representative Position:- A fun place to work, where individuality is encouraged and hard work is rewarded.- Exponential growth in a time of economic hardship.- Professional environment providing hands-on training to every team member.- Personal mentorship and development for every team member.- Growth personally, professionally, and socially.Responsibilities of the Junior Marketing & Sales Representative:Participate in daily training and sales courses with management to stay atop of industry trends, pertinent product information, and product compliance changesEngage with customers and clients face to face in a "help the consumer" mindset but still composed, upbeat, and honest mannerThe ability to close sales while maintaining a professional business relationship with consumers and potential leads.Promote client’s products to prospective and existing customersDevelop trusted and lasting relationships with consumers by providing superior customer service and displaying the highest level of integrity on behalf of the clientEngage in daily scenarios with the customer service and sales teams to guarantee their preparedness and confidence before interacting with consumersStrict adherence to all company policies and procedures as well as team accountabilityJob Requirements Requirements of the Junior Marketing & Sales Representative:- Fun and outgoing personality.- Confident and ambitious outlook.- Willing to work hard to accomplish your own goals.- Able to work in a team environment, both as a team member and as a leader.- A great student with an open mind and a sense of humor.- Our client provides full training for the right candidate.

Title: Store Manager, Bal Harbour
